Tweeter is questioning the safety of vaccines by supporting a tweet by another user who supposedly found a study about vaccination leading to end a pregnancy in the trimester.
Tweeter is saying that once some people get vaccinated then the public health authority and the government should end all COVID restrictions.
Tweeter is implying there is something sinister in the news about COVID-19 trials in Africa posted by the University of Oxford medical division.
Tweeter is agreeing to a post by another user that vaccines should be accessible to all.
Tweeter claims that India reduced its COVID cases by treating patients with ivermectin instead of vaccinating its population.
This pro-vaccine post encourages people to get vaccinated because the tweeter says that is the key to a new normal.

This tweeter says they only had to show a vaccine passport once in recent months, and wonders why anti-vaxxers are making such a fuss about the passports. This is a pro-vaccine tweet which implies that freedoms are not being restricted by vaccine mandates.

This tweeter appears to be anti-vaxx. They are dismayed at Australian politician, Jacqui Lambie for some COVID-19 related reason - it is difficult to say which as there is no date on this deactivated tweet. But likely because she supported a fast roll out of vaccines.

This tweet has been deactivated and it's not entirely clear who they are talking about, but the write is anti-vaxx and seems to equate vaccines with money making. The tweet also promotes conspiracy theories and refers to vaccinated people as guinea pigs.
This is a news article about four approved vaccines being available in Nigeria. It's inherently pro-vaccine although the tweet passes no comment.
Tweeter is praising India's vaccination drive.
This is a tweet by the COVID-19 Actuaries Response Group posting about their bulletin which has news about vaccine safety and the duration of mRNA vaccine protection against the Omicron variant.
Tweeter was engaged in a brawl with another user over the vaccine mandate, which she opposes.
Tweeter is promoting a conspiracy theory that Mark Zuckerberg is behind COVID vaccination that will supposedly kill people/humanity.

This tweet is in reply to a story about two anti-vaxx parents who claim they can't visit their child at the hospital due to COVID-19 vaccine mandates. This tweeter says that there is a big issue with their problem, outside of vaccinations. He's implying that the parents are irresponsible for not making a sacrifice in their beliefs for their child.
This anti-vaxxer made a snide comment in reply to a news article about COVID-19 cases rising in Israel in early 2022. The tweeter makes fun of vaccines by mocking their effectiveness.
This pro-vaccine tweeter remarks about the irony of police in America who refuse vaccines while their colleagues die of COVID-19.

It's not clear if this is anti- or pro-vaxx. The tweeter is vaccinated but is making a comment on being strangely cold since getting their booster shot. The following tweets in this tread are nonsensical.

This anti-vaxxer is angry at Francois Legault for allowing vaccine passports in Quebec. She feels "damage" has already been done by that public health policy and that freedom fighters will never forget it.
Tweeter disagrees with the vaccine mandate and implies that the COVID vaccine would likely harm her children.

Tweeter is saying that since the US press secretary contracted COVID even after being vaccinated, she was paid to lie about the vaccine's effectiveness. Tweeter fails to note the press secretary's full statement about having mild symptoms.
Tweeter shared a Brietbart article about a U.S. Army general resigning from service over the Biden administration vaccine mandate for all service members.

Tweeter is implying that the definition of a vaccine was changed deliberately by scientists to apparently sell the mRNA COVID vaccines, which, the tweeter believes, do not work against the coronavirus.
Tweeter is under the wrong impression that COVID vaccines are untested and unapproved and fails to understand why the vaccine may not totally prevent new infections or stop transmission completely.
Tweeter posted a news report about a U.S. sheriff apparently creating a safe haven for anti-vaxxers.  The report is behind a paywall so its authenticity could not be verified independently.
Tweeter posted an Indian state politician speech noting that not all the eligible people of the state received the COVID vaccine.
Tweeter is announcing his/her position regarding anti-vaxxers.
Tweeter is predicting that they might lose their job at the hospital because of the vaccine mandate.

This anti-vaxxer posted some information from Vaers about a 16-year-old boy who died from the vaccine due to an enlarged heart. This post is misleading because anti-vaxxers flooded the Vaers system -- its public information may not be accurate due to biased or falsified reports.

This is a response to a tweet comparing lockdown measure in effect in different states in Australia. User is emphasizing that Queensland only has relative amount of freedom because of its high vaccination rate, meaning the freedoms will disappear if people start to get complacent and refuse the vaccine.
Tweet is a link to a Fox Business headline about the likely drop in efficacy of the Moderna vaccine against the Omicron variant.

User thinks it is hypocritical that people are required to disclose vaccination status to order fast food, but not required to inform sexual partners about potential exposure to HIV. User seems to be reffering to the repeal of HIV criminalization laws, but there are still penalties in place for knowingly transmitting HIV and other diseases in most states.
User is attempting to explain to antivax users how vaccines limit community spread.
Tweeter doesn't trust the vaccine because health experts promote it without knowing anything about it.

Seems to be referring to someone who publicly stated they were not vaccinated and received backlash. User is defending this person on the grounds that it is rude to presume people are unvaccinated because they are anti-vaccine, and we should give her the benefit of the doubt in case her exemption is medical. Original tweet/account not available, but appears to be a bad-faith argument.

Tweet is from a microbiologist. This tweet seems anti-vax at first, but the rest of the thread is a nuanced argument about global herd immunity and expanding access to vaccines and boosters in poor countries. Includes link to a study on how having portions of the global population unvaccinated leads to mutations and decreased vaccine efficacy.
Tweet is from a bot made by PEI health department that broadcasts when and where vaccines are available for children.
Tweet is from an educator in Manitoba who is excited that Covid vaccines are being approved for children under 5 years old.

This post doesn't reveal the tweeter's judgment about vaccines, rather he provides information about the percentage of vaccinated people in America, based on the number of vaxxed people provided by the vaccine tracker. It's hard to tell what this tweeter's stance is based on his Twitter profile, he is likely pro-vaccine.

This tweeter is pro-vaccine yet he is angry that Ireland did not provide vaccines to the Global South. The tweeter says he won't get his third vaxx because he believes it should go somewhere where it's needed more.
criticism_other: Vaccine hoarding, vaccine apartheid, Ireland's policies

meaning: This anti-vaxxer criticizes mRNA vaccines. He implies that they are not safe or effective by saying the government is profiting from them. He alludes to corruption within the medical system.
User is claiming large number of New Zealanders are being harmed by side effects from the vaccine, and pressuring people to get it is causing harm.
User claims it is illogical for restrictions to remain in place in Ontario now that 90% of the population is vaccinated.
support_other: ending pandemic health measures in Ontario

meaning: Tweet is from the Ontario Parent Action Network expressing support for the idea of mandatory Covid vaccination in public schools, and calls on the government to facilitate vaccination for children in schools.

Tweet is a response to another antivax user claiming the risk of the Pfizer, AZ, and Moderna vaccines are "orders of magnitude" greater than other childhood vaccines, and advocating Novavax instead. This user seem to think the reason Novavax has not been approved yet is because the government knows it is much safer, and wants people to take the unsafe option.

Tweet is from Tomi Lahren, a famous far right media personality, using lockdowns, mask mandates, and vaccination campaigns to make an argument that America is falling apart. Includes criticism of immigration and BLM protestors as well.
Tweeter writes to anti-vaxers that people couldn't be bothered to get vaccines before but did it once it was required.
Tweeter asked Idaho Governor if they can arrive without a vax. States they are a prisoner here as they aren't vaxxed.

Tweet is a misquote of an article about Omicron and Delta resistance to vaccination. Study compares efficacy of 2 vs 3 doses in the short and long term, and concludes that effectiveness of vaccines waxes and wanes depending on the time frame and specific mutation. No basis for what is written in the tweet. Keyword: Scientific illiteracy.
Link to an article about India officially vaccinating 81 crore (100 thousand) people as of September 2021.

User is replying to another user in Australia who was arguing lockdowns do not prevent spread. Tweet argues if a particular media outlet (entertainment 9) would stop spreading misinformation, more Australians would follow public health guidelines.

This anti-vaxxer claims that 1000 people died from the Pfizer vaccine and that it was kept a secret by someone. This is misleading: various news reports say that deaths were not linked to that vaccine.
This anti-vaxx, anti-science person believes that parents should dictate whether or not their kids get vaccinated. She calls the pandemic "health hysteria."
support_other: Parents controlling what happens to their kids

meaning: This anti-vaxx tweeter claims that vaccine passports, when required for travel, are a form of xenophobia. This is completely absurd, given the pandemic was a public health emergency.
This anti-vaxxer celebrates firefighters and police who filed a lawsuit regarding mandated vaccines in their work place.
support_other: Firefighters and police for filing lawsuit over vaccine mandates

meaning: This tweeter seems to promote vaccines and asks a question about why children got one, not two, vaccines. They pose a question about this being as a result of a vaccine shortage, rather than an issue of science about doses.

A tweet calling on people to stop the sale of a vaccine production facility in the UK. It says that the production of the vaccine is in the public interest and the government ought to control its production and distribution.

A tweet from a registered nurse about the strain the pandemic has put on her personal and professional life. She hopes vaccinating her infant son will provide her family the protection it needs to live life freely.
A tweet from Global News telling people that Canadian children will soon be eligible for the Pfizer vaccine.

A reply in an argument about misinformation on podcasts and the nature of collaboration in science, criticising Joe Rogan and conservative media for promoting people like Robert Malone who misrepresent vaccine science.
Tweeter reminds health care workers that they should get their J&J booster.
Tweeter states people can trust science and question the vaccine.
Tweeter implies that because vaccine sales increased, there is something coming next. Very vague.
Tweeter states that some vaxxed people don't want to disclose that because they are against mandates.

Retweet of a headline from the UK Telegraph painting Nicola Sturgeon's Covid response as muddled and half-baked. The main issue in the story is whether or not vaccine passports are a good idea in Scotland.
This anti-vaxxer calls out various politicians or public figures in Scotland for adding vaccine passports to the COVID-19 restrictions.

This anti-vaxx tweeter says that vaccines are more dangerous for kids than COVID-19 itself is. This is completely false information. She claims that myocarditis is a bigger risk than COVID-19 for kids 12 to 17. Various news reports debunked this claim.
This anti-vaxxer is angry that a man can't get a heart transplant because he isn't vaccinated.
criticism_other: Hospital treatments based on vaccine status

meaning: This is an informational post about a person being monitored after coming into contact with a COVID-19 positive patient. The tweet doesn't pass judgment on vaccines.
This tweeter laughs about anti-vaxxers who claim the COVID-19 vaccine makes them less "pure blood." She's clearly pro-vaccine.
This post promotes vaccination of children and contains information on how to do that. The post seems targeted at the New York area.
This anti-vaxxer claims that the CDC's data regarding vaccination of kids is "dodgy." And she says that the vaccination of children is controversial.
This is an informational post from cinemas in Ontario. It simply states that the vaccine passport is no longer required.
Tweeter talks about finally getting the vaccines to people and shares the date for second doses.
Tweeter says vaccines are great but that the public shouldn't just rely on them alone and still follow mandates.
User is advocating for vaccines as the best way to end lockdown measures
Tweet is a disrespectful celebration of the fact that New Zealand's High Court overturned a vaccine mandate put in place. References to discrimination, segregation, and violation of human rights.

A reply to a tweet from Ethan Klein criticising Joe Rogan for spreading misinformation and causing vaccine hesitancy. It links to a video of Joe Biden and other democrats vocalising their mistrust of the vaccine on the news early on in the pandemic.
User is claiming ineffective vaccines which do not prevent infection will cause more dangerous and resistant variants to spread.
A reply to a tweet about church from a conservative politician, arguing that religious beliefs and vaccine science and coexist.
A tweet criticising vaccine mandates calling it discrimination. It argues that the vaccine doesn't work and the only reason people are getting it is coercion.
Tweeter stated to increase vaccinations, Quebec required proof of vax to buy weed and alcohol.
In support of hospitality businesses, tweeter says to remove bans on anti-vaxxers.

A tweet arguing that there ought to be legal action against Pfizer for breach of contract, it also says the change of the vaccine definition was because the vaccine is ineffective. It also implies conspiracy to hide what is in the contract with the government.
A tweet telling people that they need to proof of vaccination to enter the Tim Hortons arena in Hamilton,
User is claiming that vaccine mandates are a plot to kill the majority of the population and that mainstream media is complicit or facilitating it.
User is claiming vascular damage from the vaccine can be mitigated by taking a supplement called "Continual G," which increases Glutathione levels.
Tweeter implies that Moderna was created a year before the pandemic out of concern for re-emergence or deliberate release.
User claims her daughter and their spouse got very sick over the summer after getting the vaccine and now have psoriasis, wheras the user remained unvaccinated and did not feel ill at all.

A tweet arguing that there is not evidence that vaccines improve immunity response, that vaccine efficacy is a myth created by big pharma. Their twitter bio implies they work in show business, so clearly they are experts on immunology.
Tweeter says they can't wait until their medical privacy is restored and there are few institutions that ask for your vaccine.

This tweet is not entirely clear in terms of its bias, but it seems to be a comment from a pro-vaccine person who is dismayed that people are arguing over pandemic related science. He says that two years into the pandemic, little did he know people would still argue about public health protocols.

A video of someone talking about the lawsuit in Texas around federal vaccine mandates. It doesn't say much other than that it will be interesting to see how the court will rule, and it is unclear whether or not he wants the court to uphold the mandate.
Tweeter says Americans can't travel between States without a vaccine but claims illegal immigrants can come in without one.
Tweeter claims that the most hesitant group to get the vaccine was doctors, medical professionals, and PhDs.

User is claiming that PSA's about shingles are a sign there is a secret public health crisis, and that advertisements for cough drops are "back" after decreased rates of the flu over the last two years.
A tweet that points out that Pfizer once paid the largest criminal fine in US history, calling their CEO's criticism of misinformation hypocritical.
Targeted at vaxxed people, tweeter asks if the vaccine totally protects from Covid. They state that it is not a vax if it doesn't work fully.
Targeted at vaxxed people, tweeter asks if the vaccine totally protects from Covid. They state that it is not a vax if it doesn't work fully.
User is happily reporting that a planned anti-lockdown freedom protest in the UK had low turnout. User's profile exists to "highlight radicalization of conspiracy theorists"
A tweet criticising the level of state intervention in Britain, their opinion is that reliance on the government for things like vaccines is problematic for society.

A tweet criticising the narrative around vaccine injuries, arguing that a few thousand incidents amongst billions is cause for concern. It also implies that there is a conspiracy to hide adverse reactions.
A tweet linking to an article in the Wall Street Journal about research into the incidents of Myocarditis, especially a theory about the condition being caused by a certain spike protein.

This anti-vaxxer claims that a seven year old died from the vaccine. He also claims that "corrupt" media hid the truth about the dangers of vaccines. This is misleading and false. He also tells reads to not trust government or pharmaceutical companies.

This tweeter doesn't disclose their view on vaccines, and their Twitter profile is also not that clear in terms of their bias. But the tweeter does say they dissaprove of Bonitas for providing coverage for blood clots. The tweeter implies that this is bad form, because AZ vaccines were reported to have lead to blood clots.

Although this could be seen as a conspiracy theory related post, it seems to actually be pro-vaccine. The Tweeter self-identifies as a minister in India's government, so this is more of a PR post that shows off Bill Gates celebrating Modi for manufacturing vaccines in India.

This Tweeter claims the US government is taking people's livelihoods by instating vaccine mandates and refusing unemployment benefits for those who loss their job due to refusing the vaccine. He makes a comment about the government wanting to control people by way of the mandates, which is a conspiracy theory.

User is responding to a chart from Health Ontario showing rates of hospitalizations and ICU stays for unvaccinated, partially vaccinated, and unvaccinated patients. The user claims 23,000 healthy people have been killed by the vaccine but provides no evidence.
This is a pro-vaccine post, yet it relates to polio and measles vaccines. This post supports science and a global response.
This is a pro-vaccine post. I provides information on COVID-19 cases in Texas and encourages people to get the vaccine to protect their families.

This is an anti-vaxx tabloid post that communicates vaccines contain horrific things. The video posted along with the Tweet is not reputable and is full of disinformation that generates fear about what's inside vaccines.

This tweet passes no judgment on vaccines, rather it replies to a health care worker's tweet that vents about anti-vaxxers who don't want to disclose their vaccine status when visiting the clinic. This tweet asks if their status can be tracked through The Personal Public Service Number that Irish citizens have without disclosing an opinion.

This tweeter is pro-freedom as per her Twitter wall and likely anti-vaxx as well. This post appears to be neutral information -- it is true that Moderna is aiming to market a Covid-19 and influenza booster vaccine combo within the next two years -- yet it intends to generate vaccine distrust.
This tweet is anti-vaxx. It links to an article on a tabloid blog that is not fact checked about how vaccine mandates have destroyed employment opportunities.

This tweet by a retired medical doctor in the United Kingdom celebrates parents deciding not to vaccinate their children, citing that vaccines are ineffective and come with significant risks for children.

This anti-vaxxer made a joke about Pfizer. He said that Pfizer already made vaccines for the next 50 variants of COVID-19, to imply that boosters are a money making scheme for pharmaceutical companies.
This anti-vaxx tweeter says that OSHA suspended "Biden's" vaccine mandate, but this is not entirely complete information. OSHA suspended a vaccine mandate for business, as reported for The Hill.

This post promotes vaccine hesitation because is links to an Epoch Times article reporting that "US agencies" are studying vaccine related neurological issues. The Epoch Times is not completely reputable, and has been known to publish conspiracy theory related stories.
This is a pro-vaccine tweet, but also a pro-Modi Tweet. It celebrates Modi by saying he handled vaccination efforts in India effectively.

This pro-vaccine tweeter supports vaccines in his TikTok video that's posted along with this tweet. He talks about his shock that so many unvaccinated people are hospitalized for COVID-19. Hhe attempts to explain why vaccines are safe and effective.
This anti-vaxer equates lockdowns in Australia to "camps" and accuses the COVID-19 vaccine of being untested and unsafe. He also says the "left" segregates people who are unvaccinated.
This anti-vaxx post includes a video from London, with a crowd of protesters who are against vaccine mandates. The hashtags in the Tweet reject vaccine passports and mandates.

This Tweeter says that vaccination rates are slightly correlated with rising infection rates. She posts an academic study on a science site called Link Springer. Springer Link is a publisher platform that contains some peer-previewed journal articles, yet it's not clear if the study posted here is peer-reviewed. The title of the study does not correlate with the tweeter's claims that infection rates are rising due to vaccination, rather it says "Increases in COVID-19 are unrelated to levels of vaccination across 68 countries..."

This anti-vaxx Tweet promotes conspiracy theories about vaccine effectiveness, Joe Biden, and pharmaceutical company's profits by way of distributing the vaccine. It's not well written but clearly criticizes the vaccination of children and says it's not safe to do so.
criticism_other: Profiting off vaccines, vaccinatino of kids

meaning: This anti-vaxxer says that vaccinated people are vaccine zombies.

This is a pro-vaccine post. It appears to be about a band or some other project called Treasure. The post implies the members or people involved are vaccinated and have tested negative, which supports public health interventions.
A tweet calling out the double standard towards vaccine mandate protests, arguing the hypocrisy of how the police handled protesters harshly but blocked bridges and protested themselves.

This Tweeter praises public health interventions by listing what he goes through each day, and then by finishing the article off with "it works," by saying the death rate is lower. He's clearly pro-vaccine and pro mandate.

This tweeter posted a graph, which is not reputable, that indicates a low level of vaccine effectiveness based on certain age categories and boosters received. The Tweeter then says that people need to be careful when getting vaccinated. This is an anti-vaxx post.

This pro-vaccine tweeter celebrates Singapore for their handling of the pandemic. They say the fatality rate is very low compared to the U.S. due to public health protocols, such as asymptomatic testing.

This tweeter is asking if the Covaxin vaccine is effective because his brother received two doses of it, yet still contracted COVID-19. The tweeter doesn't pass judgment on vaccine effectiveness, rather asks about how well it works.

This is a pro-Russian, pro-Sputnik V post. It contains a conspiracy theory about the War in Ukraine, related to bio-labs being attacked in Ukraine. And it claims the WHO wouldn't pass Sputnik V for usage in the West. "An official at the World Health Organization (WHO) says the group has suspended its approval process for Russia’s Sputnik V Coronavirus vaccine, after a number of manufacturing infringements were uncovered during an inspection in Russia earlier this year," reported Radio Free Europe.
criticism_other: WHO, lack of distribution of Sputnik V

meaning: This tweet doesn't take much of a stance, and is rather communicating news about Djokovic and how he doesn't want to be vaccinated. But the tweet is inherently anti-vaxx because it posts an article by RT, which is notoriously anti-vaxx. That outlet is filled with disinformation and would be considered a tabloid news source.

This tweet claims that the mRNA vaccines will destroy the benefits of previously injected non-mRNA vaccines. The tweet is inherently anti-science yet the tweeter may have once been pro-vaccine and now doesn't accept mRNA vaccines. Regardless, they are anti-vaccine in relation to COVID-19.
This tweeter says that the unvaccinated population rate is going down. They say that the vaccine hesitant are beginning to see the light and are seeing that anti-vaxxers are conning them.
A tweet from Greg Kelly about how mainstream media has been trying to hide the court's decision against the federal mandate. It misrepresents the court's decision as well as the coverage on it.

This anti-vaxxer is angry that the Canadian government discussed suspending unemployment benefits for people who lost their work due to not being vaccinated. He implies that he will sue the government if that idea is approved.
criticism_other: Trudeau, loss of benefits due to not being vaccinated

meaning: This anti-vaxx tweet claims that the COVID-19 vaccine kills kids - more than the virus itself - at a 117x higher rate. This is false information. The tweeter linked to an article in "The Expose" blog, which is not reputable, to prove this.

This anti-vaxxer says that multiple booster-vaccinated people have been brainwashed. They make a sarcastic comment about pro-vaxx people being able to take four vaccines a year for the rest of their lives, stating that it's a vaccinated person's choice to do that if they want.

This health care worker is angry that a tweeter said unvaccinated health care workers should not be allowed to work. This tweeter replies by saying nurses already worked without PPE and without vaccines at the beginning of the pandemic, and says she should be able to work now despite vaccine mandates.

This tweeter appears to be pro-vaccine and anti-mask. He says that masks may work but that we should "stop" with the mask. His tweet is in reply to a Fox News article that reports a story about a young girl who pleads her school to stop mask mandates.

This tweet says that a governor is going to Florida to sign documents to ban legislation of vaccine mandates. This tweeter calls those mandates "unconstitutional" which is misleading given the pandemic is an emergency situation.
This pro-vaccine Tweet says that there's a low vaccination rate in America due to the individualism embodied by that nation. This is a matter of the Tweeter's opinion.
This pro-vaccine tweeter says that anti-vaxxers are "dangerous idiots."
This tweet lists off various scientific ways that Jamaica could improve their pandemic response.
criticism_other: Jamaica's ability to answer scientific questions
support_other: Funded research, scientific collaboration, valuing data, academic freedom

meaning: This tweet is anti-vaxx. It links to an article on a tabloid blog that is not fact checked about how vaccine mandates have destroyed employment opportunities.
A tweet arguing that there is no evidence that vaccines work at all, it also calls them "very experimental garbage".
This tweeter complains that they were labelled as an anti-vaxxer, and that their fans are embarassed, by a journalist. The Tweeter says there's no proof to ground that claim on.

This article is about Washington state threatening the funding of a school that didn't follow vaccine mandates. The post is made on a right wing publication that is not great at fact checking, and it's not clear if this news is real. A few other news articles with the same content came up on publications that are not well known.

This is an anti-vaxx tweet that says indigenous people showed up to give support to truckers in Ottawa. The tweet claims that Trudeau has a "vaccine agenda" and therefore this person supports conspiracy theories while using indigenous people as tokens for the cause.
This post supports monoclonal antibodies as treatments to COVID-19 and is therefore anti-vaxx.
This tweeter says they are fully vaxxed but that the population of anti-vaxxers have lost trust due to "coercion" and vaccine passports. The tweeter also considers the vaccines as ineffective.
This is a news article about how some nurses faked COVID-19 vaccine passports and entered them in the state database and made a profit off this scam.
criticism_other: Criminals, makers of fake vaccine passports

meaning: This is a pro-vaccine post that says Pfizer released a third shot to reduce Omicron induced infections.
This anti-vaxxer refers to vaccine mandates as tyranny. He also says that anti-vaxxers are second class citizens.

This tweeter supports protein based vaccines but clearly doesn't want an mRNA vaccine because they're willing to travel to Canada for the Novavax vaccine. While this is a pro-vaccine post, it clearly shows hesitation for mRNA vaccines.
This is a news article from the New York Times regarding high daily cases in light of the booster vaccine being released. The tweeter places no personal opinion into the post.
This anti-vaxxer promotes natural immunity and criticizes vaccination of children and vaccine effectiveness all in one tweet.
This tweeter says that vaccine mandates could be cause for a revolt and could lead to violence. This is clearly an anti-vaxx, anti-liberal tweet.
This woman says she's critical of news that there is vaccine inequity but it's not really clear what her views are.
This tweet is pro-vaccine. It's a quote from a news article featuring Howard Stern, who publicly criticized anti-vaxxers for compromising his freedom to live.
This post provides information about a vaccine plan that prioritizes the elderly. It contains no personal opinion but is clearly pro-vaccine because it doesn't criticize vaccination.
This anti-vaxxer proclaims that vaccines are not safe while tagging various Australian people to get their attention on this matter.
This pro-vaccine tweeter says that a new rule is needed: If you're not vaccinated you're not entitled to ICU because you're clogging up the system.
This anti-vaxxer claims that the vaccine is a "eugenics bioweapon." He says that the government or health officials are normalizing the negatives of vaccines to control the population.

This anti-vaxxer lists on his profile that he is anti-mandate. This tweet accuses Pfizer of creating a fake vaccine, which implies it isn't effective. The post also attacks some figure for engaging in cancel culture (it's not well written so it's not clear who).
This tweeter replied to a post from someone who contracted COVID-19. The Tweeter asks what public health measure failed. This implies an anti-vaxx, anti-mandate policy.

This is a sarcastic tweet regarding a U.S. politician who made ludicrously uneducated comments about the virus being invisible and therefore impossible to stop. This tweeter appears to be progressive based on her profile and therefore this comment mocks that U.S. official.
This anti-vaxxer celebrates Steve Cortes for not revealing his vaccine status in light of mandates and mandatory testing if not vaccinated for employees at Newsmax.
Tweeter seems to believe that the COVID vaccines are biological weapons. He throws a lot of medical terms and refers to a scientist but does not provide any link in support of his theory.
Tweeter is supporting Scotland's vaccine distribution approach in comparison to that of England, but did not provide any link to support their argument.

This tweet is in reply to a suspended account but it appears someone posted about some sort of vaccine injury. Tweeter's position is not clear in relation to the tweet, but their account has anti-vaccine posts.
This pro-vaccine post says that the public needs to be on guard and that vaccination, especially of youth ages 15 - 17, needs to accelerate.

This tweeter is bending the message of a news article that was posted along with this tweet. She frames the news about Israel curbing the use of the green pass due to false assurances that it creates as mandates not working at all. This is clearly a pro-Freedom, anti-vaxx post.
This is an informational post from a reporter in Halifax about the vaccination rate of children and other age groups. The tweet contains no personal opinion, yet it is pro-vaccine by nature.

This anti-vaxx Tweeter claims that Trump was colluding with pro-vaccine entities in India amidst chaos in the US in the summer of 2020. This hints at conspiracy theories and implies that the pandemic was created for profits.
This anti-vaxxer claims that vaccines are not safe nor effective. He posts an image with text to say that the "mRNA experiment" needs to stop. This is a conspiracy theory.
This is a news report from a journalist. It contains no personal opinion but reports that a tax-payer backed vaccine manufacturing factory was sold to a U.S. company.
This tweet just asks a question about a vaccine status. There is no clarity as to who this refers to and there is no personal opinion involved.

This tweet is part of a pro-vaccine thread. This tweeter previously wrote that vaccines prevent severe illness and long COVID-19, therefore she recommends getting vaccinated. This post contains information about COVID-19 data and the source is not listed.

This anti-vaxxer claims that a whistle blower at Pfizer leaked information about fetal cells being kept as a secret. The tweeter implies that the company tried to cover up the involvement of fetal cells in the vaccine manufacturing process, which is misleading.
criticism_other: Fetal cells being used in vaccines, Pfizer

meaning: This anti-vaxxer says that the vaccines has tracking chips, to track people who are jabbed.
This tweeter seems to be making fun of anti-vaxxers for hyping up anything negative, no matter how infrequently it occurs, about vaccine safety.
Tweeter is saying that the COVID vaccine will somehow affect a person's brain because he has unverified and unproven information that a higher number of flu shots causes Alzheimer's.

Tweeter is apparently summarizing a quote about the necessity of vaccines, without attributing the quote to anyone. He is trying to explain why vaccine mandates were not lifted during the Trucker's protest.

This tweet appears to be pro-vaccine because it discusses sports teams' policies of monitoring players for proof of vaccines. It is misleading though because it claims that COVID-19 antibodies cannot be found in urine. In fact, it can, according to various science articles online.
criticism_other: Sports teams not asking players for proof of vaxx

meaning: A tweet including a video sketch urging people to get vaccinated to contain the spread of Covid.
This tweet is anti-vaxx because it claims that vaccinated people need saving but that they can't be saved.

This tweet is anti-Putin. It's not passing comment on vaccines themselves -- although the tweeter appears to be pro-vaccine -- rather it's commenting on how unreasonable Putin is for expecting the world to pick up his vaccine.
This person questions vaccine effectiveness in reply to a news report about double vaccinated people over 50 dying from COVID-19 during the Omicron surge.
This pro-vaccine tweeter says that Omicron is highly contagious and that vaccination, masking and avoiding crowded places is required to avoid contracting it.
This is information about Hamilton's testing and vaccination options.

This is a news report repost and the tweet simply relays a headline from The Hill. The article's lead is: "Parents from Indiana say their two children are suffering adverse reactions after they were mistakenly given an adult dose of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine at Walgreens." No personal opinion is embedded in this tweet.
This post claims to be pro-vaccine yet it shows suspicion over vaccine companies for making profits from boosters, therefore this post is flagged as "unsure" about the vaccine.
This tweeter calls mRNA vaccines experimental and says "the law must take its course." This implies that he, or people, will challenge vaccine mandates.
It's not clear what this tweet refers to, because some of the original tweet was deleted, but this seems to be a sarcastic anti-vaxx remark on vaccine safety or effectiveness.

This tweet provides information about COVID-19 vaccination rates and the spread of COVID-19 within India. This is an informational post and doesn't contain opinion, although it's inherently pro-science.

Tweeter is saying medical science has not come up with a way to customize its products such as vaccines for individuals. He is replying to other users, who criticized the FDA for approving the COVID vaccine for children as young as 6 months.
Tweeter is saying that the low infection rate of the Omicron variant in South Africa last year in November could be a result of vaccination.
This seems to be an excerpt from a public health Ontario report, yet it would likely be posted by an anti-vaxxer for the purposes of spreading information to the public about vaccine risks.
This tweet appears to be pro-vaccine because it congratulates someone for prioritizing the vaccination of the "worst effected" groups first.
This is a news report containing no personal opinion about the CoronaVac vaccine.
This is an informational tweet about where and how to get vaccinated on a campus.

This is a joke, which doesn't really promote anything. It could be a joke about anti-vaxxers who claim someone they know who knows someone died of the vaccine, but it's not clear. It's just a joke about vaccine and COVID-19 claims, that relates to Rugby.

This tweeter is anti-vaxx and celebrates the fact that a federal court allowed Navy Seals to stay in service without being vaxxed. NPR reported that "In January a federal district court judge in Texas issued an order barring the Navy from requiring all SEALs to be vaccinated for COVID-19."

This tweeter posts information stating that lateral flow tests are more able to prevent transmission of COVID-19 than vaccine passports. This is anti-vaxx because it supports the anti-vaxx cause. It's not clear if the information is accurate as per the JCVI, yet this post is misleading because the tweeter says the effectiveness of testing mocks vaccine passports.
This tweeter is angry with Ron DeSantis for speaking in circles about vaccines and for promoting vaccine disinformation. This is a pro-vaccine post.
This is a news post regarding vaccine mandates being lifted in New Zealand. The post does not contain personal opinion.

Tweeter is insinuating that there is something sinister in the U.S. Human and Health Services paying news media to run vaccine campaigns, despite the fact that advertisement from public agencies is a major income source for media outlets.
Tweeter is criticizing Donald Trump in reply to another user's criticism of  President Biden's vaccine mandate and support of the Trucker's convoy protesting the mandate.
Tweeter is insinuating that vaccine misinformation flyers distributed in a locality in the UK is correct and a UK politician warning constituents about these flyers is wrong to do so.
Tweeter is equating the fear of witches in 15th century Spain to today's fear of vaccines. But it is not clear if Tweeter's position is in favour or against anti-vaxxers.
Tweeter is saying that the reason a new variant of COVID emerged last year has something to do with not enough people getting vaccinated.

The Canadian Liberal Party's press account is trying to gain political points by quoting a Globe and Mail report on Conservative Leader Erin O’Toole not disclosing his party members' vaccination status.
Tweeter is debunking a conspiracy theory about Bill Gates apparently talking about killing people with vaccines.
Tweeter is implying that America's public health messaging on vaccine, mask and social distancing was not effective.

Tweeter is promoting a conspiracy theory that the pandemic was a tool for the pharmaceutical companies to vaccinate people and apparently injure them so that pharmaceuticals can sell medicine to treat the injury.
Tweeter is encouraging people to join a bloc that would work to ensure equity in global access to vaccines.
Tweeter is laughing at an American burger joint for protesting against the vaccine mandate.

This is a quote from a New York Times article about the pandemic. It doesn't contain opinion on vaccines. The quote may imply that we have not done enough to fight COVID-19 and therefore could be a pro-public health measure tweet.
This tweeter is pro-science and urges people to keep Thanksgiving dinners small. The tweeter says vaccination is not enough, that masking and social distancing are essential.
support_other: Social distancing, measures other than vaccines

meaning: This seems like a news report about Pfizer being authorized for usage in kids 5 to 11. The link which is posted with this article is deactivated though. It's possible that link provided anti-vaxx connotations to this post.

This anti-vaxx tweet rattles off "information" which is misleading about children not getting sick from COVID-19. The tweeter says kids are being hospitalized with mild COVID-19 symptoms only. A link to a chart is provided but it's not clear what the chart's source is due to a foreign language being used.

This tweeter is pro-vaccine. They replied to an anti-vaxxer who celebrated a far-right politician, who criticized Trudeau for instating the Emergency Measures Act. Another tweeter claimed the world criticized Trudeau for that move, and this Tweeter tells viewers that a far-right politician does not represent the world.

This tweeter believes public health measures are a way to keep people "compliant" which riffs off various conspiracy theories. They oppose masks and vaccines and say that "good" and "stupidity" are intertwined within people who believe in such mandates.
This anti-vaxx tweeter says that someone was denied a serious operation because they were unvaccinated. The tweeter scoffs at this asking "when does this end?"
Tweeter is applauding a documentary by the right-wing media outlet Daily Caller on first responders who are against vaccine mandates.

Tweeter is falsely claiming that Chinese COVID vaccines cause leukemia, and is insinuating that Pfizer vaccine might have harmful effects too. Therefore, the Indian Prime minister was apparently right in not allowing those vaccines in India.
Tweeter is criticizing people, who are not vaccinated, because he lost a friend to COVID. Tweeter believes his vaccinated friend got the infection from unvaccinated people.
Tweeter is criticizing health authorities for their late approval of COVID vaccines for children because she is worried about her kids getting infected with the virus.
This tweet reports information about how Canadians donated to vaccine equity, as a global response to the pandemic. The tweeter is a journalist from Ottawa.

This tweeter claims they had myocarditis as a side effect after being vaccinated. They are upset that they can't file a report on this "side effect" because the doctor said there was too much of a time gap between the incident and the reporting time.
This anti-vaxx tweeter says he didn't need a vaccine passport at a restaurant in Texas. He says that in New York there are mandates in place and he calls those mandates a "shame."

This tweet is not pro- or anti-vaccine. It is pro-live your life. The tweeter thinks people should stop social distancing or isolating because the vaccination rate is high. He promotes living life as normal while he doesn't clearly promote vaccines.
This tweet criticizes actor Steve Burton for not getting vaccinated and failing to protect the vulnerable.

This tweet was made by controversial doctor Eric Feigl-Ding. He has been criticized by other doctors in the field for not being the expert he claims to be. He is not an epidemiologist and has been slammed for exaggerating COVID-19 facts. This tweet appears to be anti-vaxx and spreads vaccine hesitation.
This tweeter says that his mom has COVID-19. He's pro-vaccine because he says she is "thankfully" vaccinated to imply he's optimistic she'll recover.

This anti-vaxxer celebrates Sweden and presents misleading information about how successful Sweden's approach was to the pandemic. Sweden is highly criticized internationally for failing to lock down at the beginning of the pandemic, which lead to extremely high infection rates.
This is a news report about the Boss Tones band splitting up due to an anti-vaxx controversy. The post itself presents no personal opinion.
A school tweeted about its next HPV immunization event.
A tweet arguing that masks and vaccines don't work, it seems like a reply in a conversation that has since been deleted.
Tweeter is propagating the conspiracy theory that Bill Gates and other wealthy investment bankers have something sinister to do with the pandemic and the vaccines.
Tweeter is replying to an Australian politician saying that vaccines do not prevent COVID transmission. The original tweet by the MP could not be found.
Tweeter is replying to another user who called the COVID vaccines "rushed" and refuses to get vaccinated, even though people are dying from COVID.
Tweeter is claiming that anti-vaxxers took the viagra pill, which supposedly killed more people than the COVID vaccine.
This anti-vaxxer makes fun of vaccinated people because he feels they think they're like "god" even though they can still catch and spread the virus.
This anti-vaxxer made a joke about vaccine passports and asks if shoplifting without one is considered a loophole.

This is a news report about a man who was unvaccinated, who caught the Delta variant. The report says he now believes in vaccines as a result of contracting the virus and having a traumatic experience. This is inherently pro-vaccine.
This tweeter shares a list made by ex BBC reporter, Anna Brees, of places that don't require vaccine passports. This is an anti-vaxx post.
This tweeter says that Trump supporters are the least likely to get vaccinated.

This tweeter claims that COVID-19 is nothing more than a flu and criticizes putting public health safety before the economy. The tweeter also criticizes the vaccination of children, as well as quarantine measures.
criticism_other: Vaccination of children, putting health before economy, severity of COVID-19

meaning: This tweeter is anti-vaxx because they claim the vaccine caused a wrist fracture. The link posted with this tweet is no longer active.

This tweet is anti-vaxx because it says "high-risk" animals (with the "high-risk" in quotations) will be vaccinated for COVID-19. The tweeter implies COVID-19 is not a risk. The article also refers to the vaccine as "experimental" which promotes conspiracy theories.
This tweet promotes vaccines to the public and provides information on how to get vaccinated.
This anti-vaxxer is rattling off information about spike proteins but is not a doctor, therefore this post is misleading.
Tweeter is replying to another user promoting vaccination and booster shots.
Tweeter is replying to another user who argued that swimming and road accidents kill more children than COVID, therefore parents should not vaccinate their children.
This tweeter is anti-vaxx. This opinion tweet is part of a thread about masking, where he takes a very clear stance against masks. His profile contains "end vaccine hysteria" on it.

This pro-vaccine / pro-science tweet calls out Robert F. Kennedy Jr. for spreading vaccine misinformation in order to make a profit. The tweeter also says this was at the expense of black communities.
This tweeter says they need the vaccine now, so this is inherently a pro-vaccine post. But the link provided with it is deactivated, and it's not clear if there is another meaning.
This pro-vaccine tweeter encourages people to get vaxxed and boosted.
This 50+ tweeter is pro-vaccine and wants to get their booster, yet they are confused about how to do so. This is essentially a complaint about the clarity of messaging around vaccine availability.

This tweeter says that the virus is not dangerous if tests are required to confirm that someone has contracted it. The tweeter is anti-vaxx and questions vaccine safety when people are mandated to take it.
This tweeter says he was being interviewed by a journalist about the "mandatory vaccine case" which means he is anti-vaxx.
This post promotes anti-mask and anti-vaccine sentiments by equating public health measures to a "draconian" regime.
This tweeter says that some specific guys would hunt down people who forge vaccine certificates. This is a pro-vaccine post.

This tweeter says that Nobel Prize winning virologist Luc Montagnier promoted anti-vaxx sentiments. That is not true, this has been fact checked by various news sources such as USA Today. This tweeter is using Montagnier for his anti-vaxx cause.

This anti-vaxxer celebrates Sweden and presents misleading information about how successful Sweden's approach was to the pandemic. Sweden is highly criticized internationally for failing to lock down at the beginning of the pandemic, which lead to extremely high infection rates.
This tweeter is not in support of vaccine mandates or Biden. He refers to public health protocols as the "build back broke" plan.

This anti-vaxxer implies that corruption exists between governments and vaccine manufacturers. They claim that congressmen don't have to take the vaccine but that mandates exist in public so that money can be made, which is misleading.

Tweeter quoted a video by Epoch TV, a far-right media outlet with questionable source, about an American football player starting a vaccine injury website and a California doctor fighting for medical freedom.
The tweet is by an Indian news website about the country's foreign minister talking about equitable vaccine distribution at the G20 finance ministers' summit.
This anti-vaxxer says that he doesn't support the science on vaccines.
criticism_other: Claims that factory farming (beef) destroys the environment

meaning: This tweeter discusses the threats of BA.2 versus Delta within a thread. He appears to be pro-science and pro-vaccine while he posts articles from the WHO website to back up his points throughout the thread.
This is a pro-vaccine post recommending children in Africa to get the Meningococcal vaccine.

This tweeter is anti-vaxx based on the content on their profile. This post intends to say that the Australian state had limited demand for vaccines, but that isn't true because the vaccination rate was quite high in Australia, over 80%, once the vaccine was available.

It's not clear what this tweeter refers to because the tweet she links her own tweet to was deactivated. But she seems to be pro-vaccine because her tweet promotes vaccines, masks and testing kits to save lives.
This tweeter is asking about what the duration between two AZ vaccine doses should be.
This tweet promotes prayer for a girl that he claims had a bad reaction to the COVID-19 vaccine. No proof of his claim is provided in the post.
This anti-vaxx tweet says that mandates divide people.
This tweeter says that COVID-19 vaccines are more dangerous than any other vaccine in history, which is misleading. This post attempts to generate fear about vaccines.
This tweeter claims that mask and vaccine mandates are ineffective because case counts are still on the rise. This is misleading because vaccination reduces the risk of serious illness.
Tweeter is arguing that if a person can use other products that are not 100 percent effective then they should be open to vaccines that are not 100 per cent effective.
Tweeter is calling Dr. Anthony Fauci a criminal because he supposedly admitted that vaccines do not work. The tweeter obtained the quote from the far-right media outlet Breitbart.
This anti-vaxxer lists of things that they think are dangerous about vaccines. But this tweeter is not a medical professional therefore this tweet is misleading and intends to build vaccine distrust.
This young tweeter claims that public health mandates don't work and that therefore government doesn't work. This is clearly an anti-vaxxer.

This tweeter is anti-vaxx. They shared a multi-hour video that claims to include only FDA experts speaking, and some express fear or hesitation towards vaccines. Various news reports say that "In the days after the meeting, social media users and bloggers began misattributing several statements from the livestream to FDA panelists, when they were actually made by independent speakers during a public comment period."
This tweeter is happy that mandates had been lifted from restaurants. He's clearly anti-vaxx and reveals excitement about being able to eat out again.

This tweet is misleading because it uses information about vaccine injuries listed on VARES to support the anti-vaxx cause, yet VARES has no quality control to verify if claims are true. The tweeter is a conservative polling company, and likely promotes anti-public health measures for the sake of "freedom."

Newsmax is a right-wing opinion news site. This tweeter posted a video about people discussing vaccine mandates, which posts freedom of choice sentiments. This tweeter is critical not only of vaccines, but also of BIDEN.
This tweet seems to be a conversation between a pro- and anti-vaxxer. The tweeter is pro-vaccine and says that an anti-vaxxer got the jab late, after realizing three colleagues died of COVID-19.

This anti-vaxxer claims that a man died of the COVID-19 vaccine and that media made a false report about his cause of death. The link posted with this article to illustrate this claim is no longer active.
This anti-vaxxer criticizes Mr. Morgan for turning into a "jackal" around anti-vaxxers. This tweet promotes freedom of choice.
Tweeter is mocking the COVID vaccine's effectiveness by quoting President Biden who spoke about protecting vaccinated workers from the unvaccinated.
Tweeter is saying to another user who called American Truckers' Convoy a performative faux protest that the vaccine mandate was not lifted for everyone in March 2022.

This tweeter claims that the government is hiding the true dangerous effects of the vaccine. This tweet is therefore anti-vaxx and promotes conspiracy theories. The link in this tweet is no longer active.

This anti-vaxxer claims that vaccines lead to the deaths of two public figures listed in the thread that this tweet replies to. This is misleading because there was no mention of vaccines being a factor is their deaths, within the linked news article.
This tweeter is happy that mandates had been lifted from restaurants. He's clearly anti-vaxx and reveals excitement about being able to eat out again without requiring a vaccine passport to do so.
This pro-vaccine tweet is critical of preacher Marcus Lamb who died of COVID-19. The tweeter says that he likely put his church goers at risk.
This tweet is pro-vaccine because the tweeter quotes pro-vaccine quotes from Justin Trudeau without negative comment.
This pro-vaccine post reports that there's a correlation between low vaccination rates and the lifting of COVID-19 mitigation measures too soon with rising infections.
criticism_other: Lifting public health measures too soon

meaning: Glenn Greenwald is a respected journalist and his tweet indicates that he'll speak about government overreach in the name of COVID-19 restrictions. The tweet does not pass judgement on vaccines per say.
This is a news article by CNN that does not contain personal opinion about vaccine mandates, and the obstacles to them, in Virginia.
This anti-vaxxer says that it's a shame that rebellious bands can only play at venues that have vaccine mandates. She believes that people should rebel against those mandates.
criticism_other: Punk music playing at venues with vaxx mandates

meaning: Tweeter is implying that anti-vaxxers or people with vaccine hesitancy should not try to justify their reluctance to get vaccinated by calling the vaccine experimental.
Tweeter is replying to another tweet, which could not be found, but it appears that there was some misinformation about the vaccine mandates in Ontario's schools.
Tweeter is claiming that the vaccine does not work as it was originally advertised but fails to add that the vaccines were never advertised as 100 per cent effective.
This is a pro-vaccine post. It contains information on a lecture about vaccines in Africa.

This tweeter shares an article from The Globe and Mail about how we can thank vaccines for reducing the COVID-19 virus to something of a flu. He also says anti-vaxxers should be happy now that that makes up more room in hospitals for higher risk, unvaccinated people.

This tweeter is anti-vaxx. They shared a multi-hour video that claims to include only FDA experts speaking, and some express fear or hesitation towards vaccines. Various news reports say that "In the days after the meeting, social media users and bloggers began misattributing several statements from the livestream to FDA panelists, when they were actually made by independent speakers during a public comment period."

This is an anti-vaxx post about how the Oklahoma National Guard rejected vaccine mandates. A month later, it was reported that "Federal court denies Oklahoma Gov. Kevin Stitt's attempt to stop military vaccine mandate."

This anti-vaxxer talks about a custody hearing he has regarding his child. He says his ex wife wants to vaccinate the child and that his fiance gets medical issues (heavy bleeding) from being near the vaccine.

This tweet reshared news about "Fraternal Order of Police Lodge 7 President John Catanzara [who] told the union members on Oct. 13 not to submit their vaccination statuses." This tweet is therefore anti-vaxx because it doesn't pass comment on that anti-vaxx news.
This tweeter says that "Big Pharma" and the government are forcing the population into taking vaccines by limiting their freedoms if they choose not to.
This anti-vaxxer twists the need for vaccines abroad (vaccine equity) by saying he helped that cause by not getting vaccinated himself.

This tweet is a statement that says vaccines won't protect infection from Omicron, which is true, because vaccines lower risk - they don't prevent infection. It's not clear if this tweet is used by an anti-vaxxer (the link in the tweet is no longer active) so I flagged this as unsure about the vaccine.

Tweeter is trying to imply that Scotland's public health authority is apparently trying to hide deaths occurring from COVID vaccines. Last fall a graph using public health data was circulating on social media showing deaths among the vaccinated were higher than the unvaccinated. Later it was proved that the data was taken out of context.
Tweeter is criticizing and name-calling Justin Trudeau saying that he apparently avoids fixing all problems by talking about vaccines all the time.

Tweeter is criticizing a  New Zealand TV channel for calling Auckland a divided city because of vaccine mandate protestors. But tweeter points out that the number of vaccinated people is much higher in the city.
This anti-vaxxer writes about his anxiety about the possibility of booster vaccines becoming mandatory.

This is a tweet that says information has been released about vaccines and it provides a link as to where to see that information. No personal opinion is involved, therefore this tweet is flagged as neutral about the vaccine.
Tweeter is implying that the PC leader Candice Bergen knew about the Freedom Convoy way before it took place earlier this year.
Tweeter provided link to a tweet by Jamaica's health secretary Dunstan Byran about how Jamaicans can get the name of the vaccine they received corrected on their vaccine certificate.

Quoting a news report about people getting COVID after attending a music festival for vaccinated patrons only, tweeter implied that vaccine mandates and other public health interventions for COVID safety do not work.
Tweeter is criticizing the media for highlighting more news about people who do not want to get vaccinated in comparison to people who got vaccinated.
Vaccines give people COVID19. We know this because countries where there have been no vaccinations also have no cases of COVID19.
The government is using vaccinations as a conspiracy to impurify our bodies, just like communists have done for years.
Vaccinations are dangerous and designed to lure people into experiments that will ultimately benefit big pharmaceutical companies.
This tweet shares a news article about United States Senators asking the Government Accountability Office to investigate low vaccination rates.
The Freedom Convoy is allowed to protest against masking and vaccine mandates but their basic rights have not been taken away. The convoy needs to base their protests on more accurate information.
This tweet shares a quote from the European Medicines Agency that too many vaccine boosters could be dangerous and cause vaccine acquired immunodeficiency.
Children returning to schools when they have not been vaccinated and when schools continue to lack appropriate safety measures is unacceptable.

User is advocating that even people who have previously had Covid 19 should get vaccinated, as natural immunity may wane over time and booster doses are already available for those who were vaccinated early on in the pandemic.

A reply in an argument where this user is arguing that the vaccine is more dangerous than the virus, in this tweet he says there are unreported vaccine deaths. He's implying that there is an effort to cover up vaccine deaths.
This tweet is by a school of arts informing students about the vaccine mandate protocol and the deadline for in-person classes.

Tweeter quoted a yahoo news article about other tennis players, receiving medical exemptions for vaccines to play in the Australian Open to imply that the Australian government deported only Novak Djokovic because of his views on the vaccine mandate.
Since the tweet is no longer live it cannot be verified which metropolitan area or High Court of Justice the tweeter mentioned, where the event took place and when, or if it actually happened at all.
This tweet is by the Wall Street Journal about the delay in the approval of Moderna's COVID vaccine for teenagers due to some risk factors.

Tweeter claimed that Australian doctors are supposedly curing COVID with Ivermectin, but giving the medicine only to vaccinated patients to make it look like vaccines work. Tweeter provided a link to another account that was suspended.
Right wing citizens have followed Trump's misinformation to the point of risking their lives, including in Trump's so-called war against vaccines and mandates.
User is pointing out what he perceives as hypocrisy or Covid theatre in restuarants' vaccination policies.
User is claiming that vaccinated people wanting to remain separate from unvaccinated people is an unwarranted fear if the vaccine is as effective as they claim.
If someone who is triple vaccinated still gets COVID19, it proves that the vaccines did not work.
Teenagers do not need to get vaccinated against COVID19 because the vaccine only protects against severe illness, which teenagers will not get.
Tweet is from a software company explaining how individuals can use their product to export and print their vaccine certificates.

Tweet is referencing another user who claims to be seeking religious exemption for the Covid 19 vaccination but works at a company where multiple other vaccines are required. Implication is that the user has received all other vaccines required to work at this specific company, so the request to be exempt from this one is made in bad faith.
User is discussing the Medicines and Healthcare Product Regulation Agency's recent approval of Covid vaccinations for children 5-11 in the United Kingdom.
Tweeter is saying that vaccine mandates enforced by governments are totalitarian. Tweeter provided a link to a video about vaccines but it is no longer available.
Tweeter is saying that vaccine mandates are apparently a tool to force people to vaccinate not a strategy to fight COVID infection.

In this tweet from November 2021 tweeter is telling the Jamaican government to first immunize the children in school and then administer the rest of the shots to adults instead of running public campaigns.

Liberal citizens are becoming too relaxed about COVID19. The reality is that COVID19 continues to be a threat amid new variants, under-vaccinated global populations, and waning immunity after vaccination or infection.
Politician Boris Johnson has incorrectly used a close contact positive case of COVID19 as an excuse to avoid coming to work, which goes against current vaccine mandates.
Violent protests against vaccine mandates in Guadeloupe have led to a dangerous situation.
User is claiming that vaccinated people wanting to remain separate from unvaccinated people is an unwarranted fear if the vaccine is as effective as they claim.
User had a positive experience while receiving the vaccine at a school because the staff put on popular music.
Some vaxxers are the enemy and want to forcefully vaccinate people against their will.
The COVID19 vaccine is not effective because so many people who have been vaccinated have gotten COVID.

Tweet seems to claim there is more research on how Ivermectin effects Covid than there is about how mRNA vaccines effect pregnant women. Wording is unclear, but seems to be in favour of Ivermectin/other alternative treatments.
Tweet shows a video of people in rural Kashmir being vaccinated against Covid 19

Tweet claims that pharmaceutical companies are refusing to study if the death rates between vaccinated and unvaccinated people are comparable and implying that if the companies chose to study it, they would find unvaccinated people to have less adverse events.
Quoting an article about Australia suspending 4000 unvaccinated health workers, Tweeter implied that the vaccine mandate is to blame for the chaos in the health sector during the pandemic.
This tweet is by an English musician promoting his concert in New York and informing fans about the mask and proof of vaccine requirements for attending the event.
Tweeter does not agree with UK politician Simon Clarke that the U.K. has been able to procure and distribute vaccine quickly because of BREXIT.
mRNA vaccines are not truly vaccines, they are merely ineffective injections of mRNA. It is important that we recognize this and change the narrative.
Some people have died from COVID19 because they were infected before vaccines were available. Comorbidities, age, and doctors’ decisions also contribute to whether people die from COVID19.
It does not make sense to mandate current vaccines when Pfizer has said that the Omicron variant will require new vaccines.
Conservative UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson made an announcement about vaccine rollout that did not match the National Health Service approach, which caused confusion and chaotic logistics.
This tweet from the Wabano Centre for Aboriginal Health asks residents, whether vaccinated or unvaccinated, to complete a survey that will help the centre prepare a better vaccine strategy.

Fox news contributor is claiming the real reason the National Guard had to be called into Massachusetts was not to aid hospitals with vaccine rollout but to combat the shortage of healthcare professionals that quit after the vaccine mandate went into place.
This tweet calls for ending all vaccine mandates.
Boris Johnson's decisions at the beginning of the pandemic led to thousands of unnecessary deaths and this needs to be investigated for accountability now.
Democratic Assemblyman Pat Burke is abusing his power to try to convince those who do not know better to get vaccinated.

User thinks it is hypocritical for police to shut down protests against vaccine mandates when they themselves are exempt from such mandates. Cannot find any evidence to support claims of broad police force exemption from vaccination.

A tweet linking a Washington Post article about new border restrictions, it's more of a complaint than criticism but it's still a negative view of international COVID regulations. It implies quarantine, testing, and vaccines are unnecessary.
A tweet implying that anti-vaxxers have been correct all along.  The tweet misinterprets and misrepresents a study in a way that makes it seem as though there is a significant risk for myocarditis.
Tweet is a headline from the Associated Press about a judge blocking enforcement of a vaccine mandate for public school teachers in New York.

A reply to a 'Libs of Tik Tok" tweet about instances where people were accidentally given saline instead of the vaccine. This user is arguing that these mistakes were the result of hastily hired and trained workers rather than a conspiracy.

A reply to someone who is allergic to the vaccine, this tweet argues that everyone who can get vaccinated should because of people who are unable to get the vaccine and those who are vulnerable to COVID. It also heavily criticises anti-vaxxers.
A tweet saying that Trump is a supporter of the vaccine but not vaccine mandates.
Athlete Callum Robinson felt bullied when his choice not to be vaccinated was questioned and criticized.
This sarcastic tweet claims that a popular anti-vax song has kept people some regions from getting vaccinated.

A tweet promoting vaccine mandates for public spaces, arguing that there are ways to avoid going to public spaces so if you don't want the vaccine just avoid public spaces.
This tweet criticizes a scientific paper that has misused COVID19 data and is now used by anti-vaccine advocates to prove vaccines do not work.
This tweet by an anti-vaxxer criticizes vaccine passports in Ontario.

This tweet criticizes UK Vaccines Minister Maggie Throup for not knowing how many retired teachers have answered the government's call to come back to work amid COVID19 related staff shortages.
This tweet reports that Pfizer is seeking approval to vaccinate children under five. While the post is inherently pro-vaccine, it reveals no personal opinion.
A tweet arguing that the division over vaccines is not worth the protection they provide. They say it would be better to sacrifice public health than to restrict the unvaccinated.
Misreading COVID19 data can lead people to believe vaccines are ineffective.

Unclear if this person is pro or anti vaccine, but they have provided a link to a study written by a controversial PhD and media personality in Australia, and their biography claims to be proudly atheist/anti medicine and doctors.
Tweet arguing that it was a bad choice for a specific unnamed person to receive the vaccine. Keywords: clot shot, vaccine caused the variant.
User seems to be debating about vaccine mandates in Ontario with another user. Claims not to support violence, but calls for the "occupation to end."
A tweet promoting the approval of the Pfizer vaccine for people ages 16-17.
A tweet mocking the reaction to Omicron, arguing that it was an overreaction because cases of Omicron rarely result in severe illness compared to other variants of COVID.
Someone tweeting about how they got their second dose of the vaccine.
This tweet includes a New York Times Opinion piece criticizing the lack of COVID19 safety measures at the 2021 Radio City Christmas show.
This tweet announces that New York is giving away free tickets to see the Rockettes at Radio City Music Hall as an incentive to get COVID19 vaccine boosters.

This tweet announces that Chief Minister of Uttar Pradesh had a meeting about COVID19 vaccinations.
This tweeter claims that because breakthrough cases are so common among the vaccinated, mass vaccination is not effective. Lockdowns, masking, and testing are needed instead.
This tweet by the City of Hamilton announces that those who are pregnant can safely choose to get vaccinated against COVID19 at any time.

This tweeter is a reputable journalist. He shares a CBC article about how a man regrets his anti-vaxx stance after his wife died of COVID-19. CBC reported that the man admits he was a victim of online disinformation.
A reply to a tweet about long COVID that implies COVID is somehow bio-chemical warfare, it also argues the vaccine is ineffective because it isn't a cure.
The Saskatchewan Health Authority announces that a walk-in vaccine clinic has reached capacity.
Tweet is drawing a link between NYC requiring vaccine passports for children and authoritarianism, calling it extremism.
A tweet criticising vaccine mandates and the people who enforced them, calling public health policy tyranny. It also supports police officers who fought against vaccine and mask mandates.
A tweet arguing that is doesn't make sense for people who have natural immunity to get the vaccine. It also claims to understand science, yet ignores what we understand about virology.
This bot retweet threatens another twitter user who is refusing to get vaccinated.
This tweet includes a Reuters news piece about Walgreens' up and down economic outlook amid fluctuating vaccine demand.
It is important to understand what vaccines actually do. They help prevent serious illness and in some cases death, but they are not death proof.
This tweeter questions why anti-vaxxers and conspiracy theorists are so focused on the dangers but not others such as air pollution.

This anti-vaxxer is misleading because they claim all anti-vaxxers are immunocompromised people who don't leave home (which isn't true of all unvaccinated individuals). This post attempts to raise sympathy for the anti-vaxx cause.
This tweet claims that Yehovah can help heal those with COVID19, while the world is turning into a vaccine Apartheid.
This tweet claims that getting vaccinated against COVID19 has caused a significant number of professional athletes to become seriously ill or die.

This is a pro-vaccine tweet that says the Republican party has not fought the pandemic with enough aggression. The tweet promotes vaccines and posts an article about how the National Guard had to help Indiana hospitals.
A tweet about a vaccine scientist urging pregnant women to get vaccinated because they are at high risk for a severe reaction to COVID.
A vaccine should not require multiple shots per year. This means the vaccine is ineffective.

Tweet is from a newspaper which covers South East Asian nations addressing vaccination rates in Vietnam. They provide an estimate of when 70% of people will be fully vaccinated in Vietnam if the trend continues.

Tweet is from an association of kidney specialists in the UK, contains a link to a brief written by a panel of specialists which recommends people with kidney disease receive two shots of an approved vaccine. Published June 2021.

Tweet is from former Australian Prime Minister Kevin Rudd. His profile contains many tweets criticizing Rupert Murdoch/Fox News, but this particular tweet also goes after the Liberal Party for failing to control the outbreak in New South Wales.

This tweet is in response to another tweet that reported Newsmax - a conservative news outlet - had been sued for spreading disinformation. This tweeter suggested pharmaceutical companies should also sue Newsmax, and similar, for spreading harmful disinformation about vaccines and alternative remedies.

This post spreads false information that Romania closed vaccination centres due to a lack of public interest in the vaccine. AFP reported that "The claim is misleading: Romanian health authorities said while some Covid-19 vaccination centres had been temporarily wound down, vaccines were still available at centres across the country."
This tweeter says that vaccine passports were a good thing because they encouraged people to get vaccinated and that saved the Alberta health system from being overwhelmed when Omicron hit.
This appears to be an informational post about how CITIBank installed the vaccine mandate. There is no personal opinion included in this tweet.
This tweeter criticizes China. He spreads a conspiracy theory about how China "knowingly" spread COVID-19 to Italy.
This tweet promotes Africa by listing a few good things Africa is doing, including manufacturing vaccines.
This is a news article about how people who lost their jobs for not getting vaccinated are not eligible for employment insurance.
