A tweet criticising the Australian government for lifting public health interventions once the population had a certain percentage of vaccinations. Arguing that just because people are vaccinated doesn't mean COVID is gone or the pandemic is over.
A tweet explaining the implications of a vaccine mandate for employees in the U.S.

A tweet including a video of Joe Biden speaking against the abortion ban. It argues he is hypocritical for supporting women's rights while enforcing vaccine mandate. Making decisions for other people's body when it comes to the vaccine but not when it comes to abortion even though it is an inaccurate comparison.
A tweet criticising intense health measure implemented in Israel because of Omicron, arguing that because it causes mild illnesses there is no need to respond to it with drastic interventions.
A tweet updating the availability of vaccines for various groups including youth, senior citizens, the immunocompromised, and health care workers.

Tweeter implied that Hollywood celebrities are two-faced when it comes to vaccine promotion by quoting a news report about proof of vaccination not being a requirement at 2022's in-person Oscar ceremony.

Tweeter is quoting a New Yorker report comparing the acceptance of the chicken pox and the COVID vaccine in America and how a mandate for the previous nearly eliminated the disease within a generation.
Tweeter is implying that an anti-vaccine mandate rally is likely to spread COVID 19. Tweeter also claimed that the extreme right is behind such rallies.
Tweeter implied that new COVID variants are developing in poor countries that could not access the vaccines because pharmaceutical companies won't lift their patent rights.

A tweet arguing that public health interventions are ineffective because of the U.S immigration policy. In the rest of this thread this user continues to blame COVID on immigrants and argue any facts to the contrary are fear-mongering.
Tweeter is laughing at anti-vaxxers' reasons for not getting vaccinated but some people may not get the joke.
Tweeter is advocating for freedom of choice with regards to COVID vaccines in relation to a tweet about a foreign tennis player's Australian visa being revoked because she is unvaccinated.
Tweeter implied that natural immunity is better than COVID vaccines because natural immunity apparently stops spread and blunts severity while vaccines only do the latter.
Tweeter implied that Hong Kong is experiencing high COVID rates because citizens were vaccinated with Sino Vac and Sinopharm, both of which are inactivated virus vaccines.
A reply to a tweet about how women are against vaccine mandates, "standing up to tyranny". This user argues women are more likely to believe science and promote the vaccine.
Tweeter was calling on the Canadian health authority to include an Indian COVID vaccine in its list of accepted vaccines for travellers. Since November 30, 2021, Covaxxin has been accepted.

A part of an argument about the safety of vaccines. This user points out that there are risks, but they are minimal and you can often find out if you are predisposed to an adverse reaction; such as an allergic reaction.
A tweet about how it is unfair to separate society based on vaccine status, arguing it's wrong to limit people's liberties based on their medical choices.
Tweeter is sharing their personal experience of the things healthcare workers need to endure to abide by COVID safety protocols.
Tweeter seems to imply that public health officials did not do enough to protect children from COVID infections and that vaccines for children should have been made ready earlier.
Tweeter implied that vaccine mandates do the work by replying to a tweet about the disease spreading in a ship despite the crew being fully vaccinated.
Tweeter is implying that anti-vaxxer men can be motivated to get vaccinated because that would reduce their chance of getting infected with a virus that may cause erectile dysfunction.
This post questions whether the CEO of Pfizer has received the vaccine. It implies that Pfizer is not trustworthy and that its vaccine is unsafe.
This tweet is by a news media in Toronto reporting that the city is making 8000 vaccine appointments available.
This post shares an article by The Wall Street Journal about Eric Adams winning the New York City Mayor Race. It appears to criticize this news, saying that the new mayor loves the vaccine passport.
This is tweet by a North Carolina church informing people about COVID vaccine booster shot appointments.
A tweet alleging people are dying from the vaccine en masse, and how public health policy has caused tragedy.
Tweeter is implying that vaccines do not work because vaccine mandates did not prevent a rise in COVID cases in France.
Tweeter is implying that instead of helping the survivors of tornadoes in Kentucky,  U.S. president Joe Biden is asking people to vaccinate against COVID 19.
Tweeter seem to criticize Quebec's premier for lifting COVID restrictions and taking other decisions regarding booster shots differently from other provinces.
A tweet arguing the vaccine doesn't work because there are other public health policies needed to prevent the spread of covid, specifically reduced capacity in indoor settings.
Tweeter is implying that tourists should avoid visiting areas with low vaccination rates to prevent COVID transmission when they return home.
Tweeter is implying that governments are sending out contradictory messages about the effectiveness of COVID vaccines.
This tweeter writes that their son has had a close contact with a positive COVID19 case and that their entire family is now isolating. It celebrates vaccines, boosters, and staying home when needed.
Tweeter is implying that COVID 19 is the same as the common cold and does not require a vaccine to prevent the severity of the disease.
Tweeter is telling another user who promoted vaccination that young people apparently do not get infected by COVID and thus vaccination is not required.
Tweeter shared an article by anti-vaccine propagandist Robert F. Kennedy Jr who misinterpreted a 2017 study as a recent study between brain disorders and vaccines.

This tweeter celebrates the fact that their eleven-year-old is going to get vaccinated against COVID19. It also writes that it is scary that the further away from Chicago you go, the more the vaccination rate goes down.
Tweeter is pointing out to another user that French president Macron's words about unvaccinated people were taken out of context, and what he really meant.

A tweet in support of the Conservative party's opposition of vaccine mandates. It's part of a huge thread opposing Justin Trudeau and Liberal public health policy, and in support of the freedom rally truckers.
Tweeter is implying that social media companies like Facebook helped promote disinformation and misinformation about vaccines falsely comparing the holocaust to vaccine mandates in the U.S.
A tweet promoting vaccinating children, showing a graphic from the CDC explaining the mild and common side effects of the vaccine.

A tweet about how people deny adverse reaction claims before verifying if the person had a true adverse reaction. It's about how the general public assumes anyone who has had an adverse reaction is lying.
Tweeter implied that governments in Europe apparently are trying to hide information about COVID vaccine causing AIDS, a piece of disinformation circulating on social media.
Tweeter implied that New Zealand was successful in preventing high transmission of the Delta variant because of its high vaccination rate but could not do the same against Omicron.

In response to a New York Times article that writes that Ivermectin does not reduce the risk of COVID19 hospitalizations, this post argues that whether it works or not, it is still a harmless drug, whereas the vaccine has killed thousands of people.
This tweet by a news website is reporting about booster shots eligibility and vaccine mix and match.
Tweeter is implying that vaccines are not effective in preventing COVID because Harvard University which enforced the vaccine mandate had to close down after a breakout.
This is a tweet by a Canadian news media reporting about the Ontario health minister changing proof of vaccination plans last year in December.
Tweeter is saying how vaccination and masks can increase protection against the COVID 19 virus.
Tweeter, a journalist, shared a news report about Ontario's chief health officer advising the public to visit the elderly outdoors unless they have received a booster shot.

A tweet criticising a school board for inadequate health interventions, arguing there is more to be done than just sanitising and masks. This user argues ventilation and vaccines ought to be part of the guidelines.
A tweet alleging that someone is dying directly because of the COVID vaccine, although it's possibly true it is unsourced anecdotal evidence that makes the vaccine seem dangerous.

A tweet highlighting numbers from a government release about adverse vaccine reactions. It highlights the numbers that seem concerning while burying the important data which shows the risk of a serious adverse reaction is extremely low.
This post by the New Yorker includes a link to an article about the latest science on booster shots. It discusses the effectiveness COVID19 boosters in individuals and in the community at large.
The tweet is by a Canadian indigenous news website reporting about incentives to promote vaccination in the community.
A tweet complaining about vaccine mandates, oddly comparing it to getting tested for HIV.
A tweet arguing information about vaccine safety is misleading, that people were misled into taking the vaccine. It misrepresents how the vaccine was marketed to make it seem coercive.
Tweeter, a republican, implied that the U.S. occupational health safety body in the U.S. was right in not enforcing the vaccine mandate as it would encroach on individual freedom.
Tweeter is encouraging people to download vaccine certificate apps on their mobile phones instead of using paper certificates.
This tweet includes vaccines as number one on a list of the best things accomplished by the United Kingdom.
This post shares a link to forms from the Solari Report website that allegedly help people fight back against vaccination mandates for work or school.
This post shares a link to a New York Post article about the fact that no issues are expected with the Brooklyn Nets players getting their COVID19 vaccines and being eligible to participate in games.
Tweeter is sharing her surprise at getting discouraged from getting COVID vaccine by her doctor's office staff, even though her doctor recommended the vaccine.

This post criticizes a tweet by a so-called AWFL (Affluent White Female Liberal) who uses the name paracetamol instead of Tylenol. It criticizes her for being angry that her child’s school calls her instead of her partner, and argues that if she were in another country, the school wouldn’t need to call her at all about trivial matters like vaccines.
Tweeter is implying that the vaccine is not needed because tweeter contracted COVID but nothing bad happened to him although he did not get vaccinated.
Tweeter implied that COVID 19 is just as dangerous as polio for children and vaccine mandate would help save lives.
Tweeter is claiming that 80 per cent of Australians apparently do not need the COVID vaccines so government should not enforce the vaccine mandate.
Someone saying they got vaccinated, but the tweet has been deleted.
A tweet criticising the governor of California for extending emergency powers for over two consecutive years, arguing that the imposition is unnecessary and implying it's an abuse of power.
The tweet is by an NDP politician sharing a Guardian article about the funding behind Ottawa's anti-vax trucker's project.
Tweeter is telling another user that Ukrainians cannot be vaccine proponents because the vaccination rate in Ukraine is low, but he praises Ukrainians for not getting vaccinated like most Americans.
A tweet equating vaccine mandates to racial discrimination. Arguing Trudeau and Liberals don't care about frontline workers, and that vaccine mandates are more about politics than saving lives.
A tweet boasting high vaccine numbers in various age groups, using it as supporting evidence for vaccine efficacy.

This post writes that the Centres for Disease Control and Prevention waited until after vaccine and booster mandates led to mass vaccinations to recognize natural immunity as valid within their policies.

This post writes that the athlete Ben Roethlisberger, who is fully vaccinated, will miss the same number of games as the unvaccinated Aaron Rodgers, but will get much less press coverage. It criticizes main stream media for making a big deal of unvaccinated athletes.
This post criticizes democratic state governors for rationing monoclonal antibodies as a way to promote vaccinations. It claims this practise has killed many Americans.

This post criticizes the European Union, writing that it is corrupt to its core because it blames AstraZeneca for their vaccine disaster. In reality, Ursula von der Leyen, Angela Merkel, and Emmanuel Macron are to blame, it writes.
This post criticizes those in favour of masks, lockdowns, and vaccines, saying they look like they have dead eyes, like soulless Medusas.

This tweeter argues for freedom of choice around COVID19 vaccinations. They argue that if they are vaccinated and safe, why does the government need to force everyone to get vaccinated - it should be a personal choice whether to get ill and die.
This post by the far-right Becker News shares an article about Navy Seals achieving a legal victory against COVID19 vaccine mandates. It calls vaccines mandates anti-constitutional.

This anti-vaxx tweeter says that children are being used as "guineau pigs" in vaccine experiments. He claims that the FDA and Pfizer admit that the safety of vaccinating children will be assessed post vaccination, which is ludicrous.
A tweet promoting a study about the effectiveness of booster shots, specifically the results that booster shots significantly protect against severe illness.
A tweet about data proving that the U.S would have reduced the COVID toll if they had the same vaccine rate as European countries.
This tweeter writes that he doubts whether vaccine passports are required or enforced in Chicago because on his visit there, he was not asked for proof of vaccination even once.
This post criticizes mass vaccination against COVID19, writing that vaccines are poison that can kill people and are being forced onto citizens.

In response to a post claiming Robert Malone is the inventor of the mRNA vaccine, this tweet shares an article by The Atlantic which debunks this, explaining that Dr. Malone claims to have invented the vaccine as a means to undermine its use.
This post criticizes the vaccine, calling it gene therapy and writing that it does not work because it is not a real vaccine.

This post criticizes the US and Canadian governments for paying media companies to advertise the COVID19 vaccines. It implies that government and mainstream media are working together towards mass vaccination.
This post by anti-vaxxer Kyle Becker writes that the COVID19 vaccines are just glorified flu shots being used to turn the United States into a tyrannical biomedical state.
This tweet says that food crops can play a role in the production and delivery of vaccines.
This post by a clinical and research centre in Kenya encourages citizens to book an appointment to get vaccinated as soon as possible. It writes that vaccines are safe and effective.

This post by journalist Jon Entine writes that when the United States was hit by the polio and smallpox epidemics, the public embraced vaccines, yet something changed with COVID19. It links to an article by the Genetic Literacy Project.

This pro-vaccine tweeter asks why anti-vaxxers ignore medical advice, yet go to the hospital for treatment when they contract COVID-19. This tweeter says that such people get even dumber after they catch COVID.
This user says being triple vaccinated is the only reason they feel safe travelling.
This post shares a link to the 1000covidstories.com website that is known for misinformation where people upload videos about their negative experiences with the vaccine.
This post criticizes COVID19 vaccine mandates, writing that they are a big fiasco.
This post shares a link to an article from Bitchute, a known fake news site, where Dr. Peter McCullough explains why mRNA vaccines are dangerous and deadly.

This tweeter says, in reply to an anti-vaxxer, that vaccines never gave full immunity. They say that vaccines reduce the risk of severe illness. They used the MMR vaccine as an example to say that they got a mild version of Rubella and Mumps despite being vaccinated as a child.
This post calls for removal of all vaccine mandates and vaccine passports immediately. It is in favour of the trucker convoy, and claims that according to the law the health emergency is over.

This anti-vaxxer says that personal and religious exemptions for vaccine mandates may not be granted by Californian courts. This tweeter says he wants to fight it and provides information on how to do so.

This post by UniServices, a non-governmental and non-profit organization, celebrates that one of its programs supports six countries in getting the COVID19 vaccine to them while keeping it cold, and training vaccine administrators remotely.

This anti-vaxx tweeter claims that propaganda and hidden information surrounds the mRNA vaccine. He posted a Fox News report about the death of Foo Fighter's drummer, Taylor Hawkins, to imply that vaccination could have been a factor in his death. Newsweek reported though, that "Hawkins died on March 25 at the age of 50 after being found unresponsive in his hotel room in Bogotá, Colombia. An early urine toxicology test found 10 different drugs in his system."
This tweeter, who claims to be pro-vaccine, criticizes Justin Trudeau, writing that he lied about having been exposed to COVID19 in order to avoid dealing with the trucker convoy.

This pro-vaccine tweeter says that 12 teenagers were hospitalized in Queensland after not getting vaccines. The tweeter says there was a failed vaccine supply. This is a comment on government, for dropping the ball on vaccination.

This news report from Pittsburgh's largest newspaper says that a new vaccine booster from a new manufacturer may be approved soon. No personal comment is included in this tweet, yet it's inherently pro-vaccine.
This post by a physician and scientist shares a link to a Nature journal issue which includes six papers on the strong immune response provided by COVID19 booster shot vaccines.
This tweet writes that the truth about vaccines is that they never made sense in the first place.

This tweet criticizes the decision by the State of California to keep the State of Emergency. It criticizes the vaccine and masking mandates, saying the people of California want to move on but cannot.
This post criticizes the effectiveness of the COVID19 vaccine, making fun of vaccine mandates and those who put them into place.

This pro-vaccine tweeter says that they have never heard of ESPN's Allison Williams, who gave up her job due to vaccine mandates. He also says that in a work place of 75 people, only one gave up their job due to vaccine mandates. He implies that anti-vaxxers are in the extreme minority and should not be given too much attention.

This tweeter says that unvaccinated people could put her at a higher chance of contracting COVID-19. She also said that vaccinated people can end up in the hospital, which is true, indicating her concern for being exposed to the virus, and to anti-vaxxers.

This post writes that if everyone who has come in and out of Australia for the past six months has needed to be double vaccinated, then at least one vaccinated traveller has brought COVID into the country. This, argues the post, shows that COVID19 vaccines are ineffective.
This pro-vaccine tweeter says OK to recommendations of not having any strenuous activity after being vaccinated. Then they post a graphic sexual video of themself as a joke.
This tweet shows pictures of people vaccinating animals in Mumbai. The tweet promotes vaccination of stray animals.
This tweeter writes that they know people who are fully vaccinated and got COVID19 within two months of getting vaccinated. The post attempts to undermine vaccine effectiveness.
This post writes that mass vaccinations will not stop COVID19 and are just a conspiracy to make us dependent on the government.

This anti-vaxxer claims that COVID-19 creates serious heart health risks. They posted a picture of a typed sign in someone's window, which says that a certain gym needs to know if their players have been vaccinated in order to assess heart risks while working out at that gym. This  tweet promotes disinformation about vaccinations creating heart problems.

This post by a scientist shares a link to a Nature journal article about coronavirus in bats from Cambodia. It emphasizes that the study’s results could be useful for the design of new COVID19 vaccines, including intranasal ones.

This tweeter doesn't really promote or criticize science, he just said that Trump did better than Biden in terms of handling the pandemic.  He says that Biden inherited the vaccine from Trump's days and that more people died under Biden than Trump, which would be due to Biden being in power for a longer portion of the pandemic than Trump.

This conspiracy theory post criticizes Just Trudeau and his followers, writing that they are all brainwashed fascists. It writes that digital ID and Police State are coming, and that neither Trudeau nor any other elites took the saline vaccine.
This post writes that amid a deadly pandemic, stark health measures were required to keep people safe. It writes that vaccines are safe and that adverse effects are extremely rare.

In response to a tweet in favour of vaccinating children, this post writes that children are relatively safe without vaccines, that immunity from vaccines starts to decline after six months, and that attempted masking in schools has been ineffective.
In response to misinformation posted by another tweeter, this tweeter writes that they have reported it to twitter for vaccine misinformation.
This post by a Non-Governmental & Nonprofit Organization in Jamaica encourages people to come get vaccinated and tested for HIV at a free event.
This post claims that Kamala Harris said she would not take the COVID19 vaccine because Trump endorsed the initiative. It criticizes left-wing politics.

This post criticizes the vaccine, writing that after the second dose of the Pfizer COVID19 shot, women are to avoid pregnancy for at least two months. It implies that the vaccine has significant adverse effects on reproduction.

This post writes that the view by some US Supreme Court justices and Canadian politicians that vaccine mandates can lead to the disappearance of COVID19 over night was already silly with the Delta variant but is now cult-level anti-science with Omicron.

This anti-vaxxer says that vaccines didn't stop the pandemic because they didn't prevent transmission. He asks what they control, if not transmission. He neglects to mention that vaccines prevented severe illness, which prevented more deaths and our hospitals from collapsing.
This pro-vaccine tweeter posted a link to a book about how junk science launched anti-vaxx culture. Her tweet intends to raise awareness about bad science that perpetuates medical disinformation.

This tweet is mildly confusing. The tweet seems to equate vaccination with contracting shingles or myocarditis. But the tweeter also says their uncle wished they had gotten the shingles vaccine because he contracted it without being vaccinated. It's not clear if this tweet promotes vaccination or claims that vaccines lead to other health risks.
This post is in favour of workplaces that offer solutions for the unvaccinated, accommodating them with programs such as working from home.
This post shares a graph of weekly deaths in the UK during COVID compared to before COVID. It claims that the increased death rate is due to reduced NHS services and bad reactions to the vaccine.

This anti-vaxxer shared a video from Switzerland. It depicts people marching in the streets to protest vaccine passports. A similar video was posted on YouTube in October 2021, so it is not clear if this video was actually taken on Nov.23, 2021.
This tweeter says they're vaccinated and utilizing double masking. They also say they'd take any boosters needed.

This tweeter promotes Japan's decision to not mandate vaccines, while saying that the West infringed on people's rights by way of "forcing" vaccines. It's true that Japan did not mandate vaccines, according to Full Fact, a fact-checking website.

This tweeter celebrates Dr. Sanjay Gupta's podcast on vaccination, because he feels it presents two sides of the debate. Sanjay Gupta is a credible CNN journalist, yet the fact that there's two sides to this debate is questionable because vaccination has been deemed as safe and effective. Therefore this post is flagged as "unsure" about the vaccine.
This pro-vaccine tweeter tells people to not be ignorant and to get the vaccine because it does protect people.
This post shares a statement made by the United Kingdom Liberal Party about vaccination, lockdowns, and vaccine passports. It appears to endorse the statement.
Tweeter implied that people should welcome the idea of a vaccine passport just because an Irish politician opposes it.
Tweeter is implying that the medical exemptions many give for not getting a COVID vaccine shot are also applicable to other vaccines.
Tweeter is implying that vaccine proponents have been changing their views about the effectiveness of the vaccine and that the vaccine actually does not work.
Tweeter is implying that COVID vaccines are not the only ones that require multiple shots. There have been other diseases for which both adults and children require to get multiple jabs.

A tweet linking to an article about how mask mandates and vaccine mandates are necessary to keep schools safe but as a whole the article unfairly criticises the government and public health officials for not giving a fixed timeline on the pandemic.

This anti-vaxxer claims that vaccines will not end the pandemic. They say that vaccines cause mutations, which is not true. The tweeter also claims that vaccines did not get rid of influenza, which is misleading, because most people currently die from influenza at a much lower rate.

This anti-vaxx tweet includes a video of a police officer taking gasoline away from Trucker Convoy members, while the video man complains that they'll freeze in their truck without the gas. The tweet itself claims that vaccines are for making money, not for creating safety, therefore this is also a critique on government and health officials.

This post links to a video about vaccination access for people with disabilities. It also writes that a state disability rights agency may have information on if someone can receive the COVID19 vaccine at home.
criticism_other: Lack of vaccine access for people with disabilities

meaning: This post compares COVID to terrorism in Syria and globally. It claims that COVID and vaccinations have been rebranded several times and that all should be aware.
This tweeter says they're excited to get the vaccine and they want to know if it will hurt when they receive the jab.

This anti-vaxxer says that vaccines are dangerous. He replied to another tweeter asking if that person received something for their services, to imply someone was getting paid off for promoting vaccines most likely.
This post by a Trump supporter writes that vaccines are ineffective because they do not prevent infection or transmission.
This pro-vaccine tweeter uses the seat belt analogy to promote vaccination. They say that seat belts lower the risk of death in a car accident, just like vaccines do if the virus is contracted.
This tweeter says COVID-19 vaccines are junk and that they would prefer antiviral remedies, which could include something like Paxlovid. This post is inherently anti-vaccine.

Although this tweet is hard to decipher because it's not well written, it seems to imply that 12 vaccine doses will be needed in the future, while they posted a news article that warns of a fourth required booster. The tweet says they got the first and second vaccine already though, so I flagged this post as "unsure" about the vaccine.
This post criticizes Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison for claiming he was responsible for initiating the COVID19 vaccine rollout in Australia.
This post by The Star Vancouver announces that British Columbia will start vaccinating children aged five to eleven.
This post celebrates that mainstream media like LBC radio has resorted to personal insults around COVID19 and vaccines, because it shows that the New World Order plan is failing.
This post by Boston 25 news shares an article about protestors who are against the vaccine mandates for workers, which were announced by Boston Mayor Michelle Wu.
This post writes that Joe Biden’s vaccine mandate for workers was blocked by another appeals court. It says the reason for this may be that the courts are afraid of the economy being impacted.
This tweet includes a text and video about how the top of the South Island has a high rate of vaccination.

This anti-vaccine tweeter replied to someone who complained about "doing the right thing" at the beginning of the pandemic. That person was angry they didn't get free food bribes from pro-vaccine campaigns at restaurants, like what was offered in the Twitter thread. This tweeter is making fun of that vaccinated person for complaining about the methods people are using to encourage vaccination.
criticism_other: Vaccinated people who complain about not getting free stuff

meaning: This post shares the reactions of vaccine experts in India to the government’s vaccine rollout. It criticizes Narendra Modi and the slow rate of vaccination.
This post shares an article that claims COVID19 vaccines cause Marburg symptoms. It also claims that a whistleblower has said that PCR tests and vaccines containing toxic ricin are in the works.
This tweet is by a financing programming network informing users about an online event on the stage 1 trial of an oral vaccine for COVID 19.
This tweet is by an Indian website reporting that India donated vaccines to Afghanistan.
Tweeter is telling another user who questioned the effectiveness of COVID vaccines by reiterating how vaccines prevented large-scale fatality from COVID 19.
Tweeter is sharing a news report about the need for vaccination and the use of face masks as COVID case numbers were rising last year in November.

A tweet arguing because people are vaccinated there is no cause for concern when case numbers and death tolls rise. Arguing the pandemic is over because we hit our targets for vaccines and health interventions, despite new variants causing problems.
This tweet includes a link to a CDC article, which reports that COVID-19 vaccines reduce the risk of asymptomatic infection and transmission. This is inherently pro-vaccine.

This pro-vaccine tweeter promotes oral vaccine pills, to fight COVID-19 through the mouth and nose, not necessarily through the blood. Oral vaccines are still vaccines, therefore I labelled this post as pro-vaccine.
This post cited the Tuskegee syphilis study and baby deformations due to Thalidomide as reasons why vaccinations should not be forced on people today.
This post writes that conspiracy theorists will no longer think vaccines are a conspiracy when someone they know dies from COVID19.
Tweeter implied that the New York City Mayor would crush protests by  NYC workers who did not comply with the vaccine mandate.
Tweeter is claiming that because of the Chinese government's enforcement of the vaccine mandate people are fleeing China. The post could not be verified.

Tweeter is running a poll on how many people think there's a conspiracy behind lockdowns and vaccine certificates and shared his theory that the IMF and World Bank are the behind that supposed conspiracy.

Tweeter, a nurse, implied that COVID vaccines are not safe because one of her patients apparently died after receiving the vaccine, but she does not mention if the patient had any other underlying condition.

Tweeter is praising an Australian politician, who has been spreading vaccine misinformation on social media, by claiming that the politician is saving Aussie children as the vaccines are apparently not safe.

A tweet from a parent about how their children wear masks even though there is no mask mandate in schools and they are double vaccinated. It's promoting caution even though the government is not mandating it.
A tweet about how travel bans are ineffective and racist, and how the best way to end the pandemic is to vaccinate people all over the world since it is a global pandemic.
A tweet linking to an article which speculated Gov. Gavin Newsom was hiding due to a vaccine injury, despite the evidence being verifiably false.
A tweet theorising that Biden and the federal government is paying off doctors to promote fake vaccine benefits. It implies widespread conspiracy and lies.
Tweeter implied that the COVID vaccines are apparently dangerous and useless.
Tweeter shared an interview from Rumble, that uses questionable sources, where the conspiracy theory that COVID vaccines' have a toxic chemical to enslave future generations was propagated.
Tweeter is implying that Canadians are not divided on the issue of vaccine mandates, most of them support it.
Tweeter is implying that booster shots should be made available to Americans who are willing to get the third dose, instead of waiting for the rest of the population to get fully vaccinated.
A tweet arguing that vaccines do not protect anyone, neither the vaccinated person nor those around him.

A tweet citing 'actual data' criticising vaccine mandates. Previous tweets in this thread the user implies everyone just ought to get sick to develop natural immunity, which also implies they are fine with people with health risks dying of COVID.

A tweet notifying people about a town hall where people could express their concerns about vaccinating their kids, and receive accurate answers about the vaccine's safety to reassure them vaccinating kids is safe and necessary.
A tweet where this user is telling a vaccinated person to 'wake up' and realise that the pandemic is fake, it implies conspiracy from the government, global elites, and pharmaceutical companies.
A tweet talking about how a non-existent HIV vaccine didn't fix the AIDS epidemic so people shouldn't trust the real COVID vaccine.
Tweeter is criticizing Evangelical Christians for spreading vaccine disinformation.
Tweeter implied that advertisers and authorities were not upset with tennis player Novak Djokovic for his anti-vaccine stance but because he lied.

This post shares an Apple news article about increased rates of pre-teen suicide amid the COVID19 pandemic. It blames Joe Biden for this, saying he has manufactured a crisis with unnecessary vaccine and masking mandates.
This post shares an article by the unreliable site The Epoch Times, which writes that according to Dr. Peter McCullough, the COVID19 vaccine is unsafe.

Tweeter shared a link where Kim Iversen, an independent analyst, opined that vaccine mandates at workplaces are similar to workplace sexual harassment women tolerated to keep their job and feed their families.
Tweeter is implying that the COVID vaccines are apparently still in their trial stage so doctors cannot force patients to get vaccinated.
A tweet which is part of a thread promoting conspiracies around the vaccine and its hanging definition. This tweet is arguing the vaccine is not truly a vaccine.

A tweet about how this user got COVID in 2020 and is arguing that they still have better immunity than people who have been vaccinated. There are several reasons why this statement is laughably inaccurate.

A tweet about a lawsuit based on unfounded allegations against Professor Karim, South Africa's Dr. Fauci, regarding miscarriages allegedly caused by vaccines. Despite the original tweet including legitimate seeming documents, no official record of the case or allegations is available online.
A tweet notifying people about a vaccine clinic, offering the hours of operation promoting walk-ins and free parking.

A tweet arguing that the vaccine is ineffective, but it cites an article that explains how even though at this point in time most people in hospitals are vaccinated, the vaccine is still effective and this is a tiny portion of the vaccinated population.
A tweet criticising anti-vaccine protestors because vaccine mandates have been implemented, especially in the military, since the first world war.

This tweet pulls quotes from a study about how in certain age groups the vaccine poses more risk than benefits, specifically when it comes to a mild variant of COVID and a healthy person who would almost certainly recover from it. The tweet makes the risks of vaccination over-simplified rather than conditional.
Tweeter shared a report from a news website with a low factual rating about a man who left an anti-vaxxers' group after getting infected with COVID.

This post criticizes anti-vaxxers, writing that because of far-right extremists, COVID19 cases and death rates in the United States are the highest in the world. It encourages people to get fully vaccinated and calls out misinformation propaganda.
This post announces the latest statistics on partially and fully vaccinated people in Australia, celebrating the fast vaccination rate.

This post criticizes the Wayanad Member of Parliament in India for not taking the vaccine to avoid losing votes. It includes a link to an article about Wayanad teachers refusing the vaccine for religious reasons.
This pro-vaccine tweeter makes fun about health care workers who refuse the vaccine. She says that they likely don't wash their hands after they poo if they are too silly to not get vaccinated.
criticism_other: Health care workers who refuse the vaccine

meaning: Tweeter is implying that unvaccinated people are responsible for the emergence of new variants and for the pandemic to continue.

A tweet about Holocaust survivors who are outraged by conservatives who compare their experiences to present vaccine mandates, it links to an article that calls for conservative media and government to apologise for their statements.
A tweet making fun of anti-vaxxers for getting COVID at a conference about alternative remedies like ivermectin.
A tweet arguing the vaccine is ineffective and calls any information about its safety government propaganda. It also implies there is a conspiracy to cover up information about the vaccine.
A tweet arguing now we have high vaccination rates there is no reason to have mask mandates.

This post criticizes anti-vaxxers, writing that it does not make sense not to get vaccinated if one knows that the vaccine reduces symptoms and chances of dying. It argues that some people decide what they believe first, then look for evidence to confirm their biases.
Tweeter is implying that the COVID vaccine apparently does not work because many vaccinated people are also getting infected.
Tweeter, who appears to be a supporter of Steve Bannon's political movement to overthrow the Chinese communist party,  is implying that science and vaccines cannot be trusted.
This post is part of a thread that predicts a much bigger BA.2-variant wave than the Omicron wave. It cites waning vaccine-induced immunity in the United States as one of the contributing factors.
This post criticizes anti-vaxxers, writing that they are unintelligent and annoying.
This post criticizes downplaying the events of 2020. It writes that the pandemic, lack of vaccines, widespread unemployment, closures, social isolation, and social unrest all made 2020 terrible.

This tweeter says that vaccines are experimental and a form of bio terrorism. They also posted a video of Kamala Harris saying that vaccinated people are in the hospitals, but Reuters fact checks this and reported that "U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris did not say that virtually every individual in hospital with COVID-19 is vaccinated, despite a video circulating online. The clip was edited to make it appear that the vice president said the word ‘vaccinated’ instead of ‘unvaccinated’."
This tweet shows photographs of a vaccination drive in India. This is inherently pro-vaccine because it promotes the vaccination of people.

A tweet linking to an article that criticises the mainstream media, doctors, and government, because they are allegedly using post pandemic stress disorder as a way to cover-up cardiovascular issues caused by the vaccine.
A tweet telling people to get vaccinated and arguing that because the vaccine is effective it is time to implement rules which will reduce the burnout for COVID-19 medical workers.
Tweeter shared a Canadian COVID 19 resource link that offers drop-in sessions for people to get their questions about the vaccines answered.
This post criticizes mainstream media for spreading the narrative that the COVID19 vaccine reduces severity of symptoms if one becomes infected.
Tweeter is sharing a fact-checking article about the misinformation that COVID vaccine has Satanic connection and also informing people about the Latin meaning of the term Lucifer.
This post makes fun of a twitter user for presumably being doubly vaccinated against COVID19.
Tweeter is taking credit as a scientist Texan scientist for developing a patent-free COVID vaccine that has been used to inoculate 10 million children in India.

Tweeter shared a link from a U.K. website, known for publishing COVID vaccine misinformation, that the number of deaths from COVID vaccine is apparently high in Australia compared to all other vaccines.

This post by a journalist from Glasgow quotes a restaurateur who is frustrated with health mandates, writing that despite following all masking and vaccination mandates, they are still not back to normal, and still worried about future variants.

This anti-vaxx tweeter claims that the Pfizer vaccine was not actually approved by the FDA. He says that BIDEN was busted for this scandal in a secret recording, which is a conspiracy theory. He posted a link to support this comment from a website that is not credible: Red Voice Media.

This post is in favour of excluding professional Basketball player Kyrie Irving from playing if he has not shown proof of vaccination to his employer. It includes a link to the current New York health mandates.
criticism_other: Employers failing to check proof of vaccination

meaning: This anti-vaxxer claims that the vaccine is dangerous for some people, because it contains a version of the virus. They are replying to another tweet that says the vaccine is a dead version of the virus.

This tweeter claims that Fauci lied about the approval of non-mRNA vaccines. The tweeter says that COVAXIN and other non-mRNA vaccines were actually approved for use in America. This is inherently anti-science because the post discredits mRNA vaccines.
Tweeter is implying that it was wrong of the New York City mayor to hold the 2022 New Year celebration despite the risk of COVID transmission.

This post criticizes the slow vaccine rollout in Australia, writing that a fear campaign was launched by the media when Australians should have already been vaccinated, compounding the problem of vaccine hesitancy.
This tweeter says they support HPV vaccines and that more men need to get them.
This pro-vaccine tweeter is criticizing an anti-vaxxer for something (their tweets were deleted). This tweeter seems to say that anti-vaxxers blame vaccines on any problem that they can't understand.
This post shares a University of Delaware article about engineering future vaccines with higher efficacy. It celebrates vaccine innovation.

This post celebrates the progress in COVID19 vaccinations made under President Joe Biden. It cites the latest vaccination rates in the United States and celebrates that vaccines for five to eleven year old children are on their way.
This tweeter is pro-vaccine because they tell the public that the HPV vaccine is for both women and men. According to various medical reports on line, this appears to be true.
This pro-vaccine tweeter says he just got his third COVID-19 shot and feels more comfortable about returning to the classroom to teach.

This post criticizes the Canadian government for their policy to terminate unvaccinated employees. It writes that those who have been put on unpaid leave due to vaccine policies are required to indicate dismissal on their Record of Employment.
Tweeter implied that an American model is apparently doing Dr. Fauci's job of promoting the vaccine because she shouted at fellow travellers in Miami airport to get vaccinated.
Tweeter implied that anti-vaxxers were rallying against vaccines that could prevent large-scale COVID hospitalization in Texas. Neither the rally nor the number of cases could be verified.
Tweeter implied that the hatred of vaccinated people towards the unvaccinated is creating division in the society.
Tweeter is implying that COVID vaccines apparently do not work and mainstream media and left-wing politicians should apologize to Americans for promoting the vaccines.
Tweeter implied that the Californian government cannot hope to achieve vaccination of 80 percent of its population above the age of 12.
This is an anti-vaxx Tweet. It claims that vaccines will reduce the population's immunity to COVID-19. The tweeter posted some graphs and text from an unknown news source to back this comment up.

This tweet promotes adding booster vaccination status to the NHS app. They shared a link that promotes this, mainly because certain countries require it and people may be denied entry upon arrival if their vaccine passport doesn't show their booster status.
This post calls for people to encourage the unvaccinated to get their COVID19 vaccines rather than to shame or blame them.

This anti-vaxx tweeter claims that people are greedy and making money off vaccines and mandates, while others lose their jobs. She also posted a number of conspiracy theory related images, one has text that says people orchestrated the pandemic as a form of population control.

This is a news post that does not contain personal information about how some students missed the vaccination deadline and therefore must enrol in independent studies. The post was made by ABC, a reputable news outlet.

This tweeter says that damage has already been done to boys ages 12 to 29 who have been vaccinated. They posted a link to another tweet that claims there was a high risk of myocarditis among boys who took Moderna vaccines. Public Health Ontario did report that "Cases of myocarditis/pericarditis following immunization with mRNA COVID-19 vaccines have
been reported in Ontario, Canada, and internationally. Reported cases have occurred more
frequently in males under the age of 30 years, more commonly following their second dose,
usually within one week of vaccination, and have been mild with a quick recovery."
Tweeter, a democrat, is criticizing the republican narrative that American students are traumatized by mask and vaccine mandates.
Tweeter shared a news report from a local Canadian newspaper about why vaccine passports are needed.
This tweet is by an Indian defence website promoting COVID vaccines manufactured in India.
Tweeter is propagating conspiracy theories ranging from the safety of vaccines, masks, the emergence of COVID, the American election being rigged, Trump's collusion with Russia and the Ukraine war.

This tweet was removed from Twitter which means it was likely used in an anti-vaxx context, rather than just being a news re-post for Fierce Pharma. The tweet contains information about floating material being found in Pfizer vials in Japan.
Tweeter implied that anti-vaxxers took the CDC director's clip out of context and spread misinformation about COVID morbidities.
This pro-vaccine tweeter doesn't understand why evangelical christians deny the vaccine when they claim to care about the well-being of other people.
Tweeter implied that businesses asking for proof of vaccination is not the same as businesses and public places that enforced segregation based on race, religion, and caste in the past.
Tweeter shared an opinion piece from The Verge about the potential benefits of the Biden administration's vaccine mandate.
Tweeter is implying that doctors are seeing patients in-person only during COVID vaccine inoculation because they are apparently getting paid to do so.
Tweeter is propagating the conspiracy theory that vaccines are a conspiracy by Dr. Fauci to apparently inject people with the HIV virus.
This pro-vaccine person says that she's disgusted by anti-vaxxers and anti-maskers. She says those people put her loved ones, and other people, at risk of dying.

This tweeter is anti-vaxx. He posted an article from NPR about how vaccines could slightly alter a menstrual cycle. Then he says that the COVID-19 vaccine is a new treatment and asks why women should be compelled to take it.
This tweeter promotes monoclonal antibodies in this tweet and wonders if that's why the death rate is lower in NYC - which means he is anti-vaxx, claiming that vaccines cause death.

This post by the Wandsworth chapter of the National Health Service in London, UK, announces that twelve to fifteen year olds can now receive the COVID19 vaccine. It includes a link to an article with five reasons to book a vaccine today.

Tweet is part of a thread by a senior fellow at the Center for Global Development pointing out the relationship between income and vaccination status. Overall thread is critical of wealthy countries hoarding vaccines and inefficient aid efforts to lower income countries.

meaning: Tweet is adamantly anti-vaccination, claiming that his "earned natural immunity" is more effective than the vaccine.

Tweeter implied that vaccines are not safe and effective and shared an article by a Democrat who supports vaccines but opposes restrictive COVID policies and shaming of unvaccinated people.
This tweet is by a news website about the Omicron variant and the clash in congress over the vaccine mandate.

This tweeter seems unsure about the COVID-19 vaccine because she says that it typically takes up to ten years to develop a vaccine. Immunize B.C. does confirm that is the standard time, yet that it can be expedited in the case of a pandemic.
support_other: Taking ten years to develope a vaccine

meaning: This is a news repost. The text was taken directly from a headline in American Military News.com However, the article is inherently pro-vaccine because it reports that Trump and Biden both agree that vaccination is a good thing.
Tweeter is implying that poorer countries cannot access the vaccine because the population in rich nations is taking longer to vaccinate due to the presence of anti-vaxxers.
This tweet is pro-vaccine. The tweeter says that people would take an HIV vaccine if one existed.

meaning: Tweet is from a scholar specializing in the field of anti-government extremism. Tweet is part of a thread on a California Sheriff who has ties to the Oath Keepers and is refusing to enforce a vaccine mandate.

A tweet criticising every pandemic response; public health interventions, politicians, media, economic interventions. It also implies there will be a reckoning where the people responsible for the pandemic response will be imprisoned.
This anti-vaxx tweeter says the government hid adverse vaccine effects from the public. They say that the vaccine is full of "sh*t" and that the government doesn't want to show that.

This is a news article about how the CDC told people to stop taking cruises, regardless of vaccination status, due to Omicron outbreaks. Although the post contains no personal opinion it is flagged as pro-vaccine because it reports public health information.
This is a pro-vaccine news re-post (paraphrased). The tweeter says that Pfizer and Moderna authorized authorized the second doses of vaccines for older adults and immunocompromised people.

Although this information about J&J vaccines leading to blot clots has been reported as true, this tweet is flagged as anti-vaxx because it was disabled by Twitter, which indicates it was used to spread vaccine fear.
Tweeter is hinting at the conspiracy theory that the pandemic and the COVID vaccines are a product of the World Economic Forum.
Tweeter is implying that people are unnecessarily dying from COVID because republican governors are telling people not to wear mask or vaccinate.
This post criticizes Joe Biden and the COVID19 vaccine mandates in the United States, claiming that it is stupid to mandate a vaccine that neither prevents infection nor transmission.

Tweet is from a Irish user responding to a graph showing that only 20% of children in Ireland had one vaccine dose by Feb 2022. This user claims it could be because families have had to cancel vaccination appointments if a member of the family becomes sick.

Tweeter implied that the COVID vaccines were not developed using proper scientific methods. He claims that during the trial people who showed positive results belonged to the placebo-controlled group.

This post quotes the World Health Organization, writing that low COVID19 vaccination and low testing rates are a toxic mix.

Tweeter is implying that the coronavirus was apparently created by pharmaceuticals and governments so that they can sell vaccines and impose vaccine mandates to control people.
Tweeter is implying that COVID vaccines are not safe like vaccines for other diseases because enough research was not carried out for the COVID vaccines.

support_other: Transparent FOI records about vaccination, Taking the FDA to court

meaning: Tweeter is telling others that BBC was broadcasting the parliamentary session where a UK politician placed a bill forward for COVID vaccine damage payment.

Tweeter implied that since a parliamentary committee in U.K. found no scientific basis for vaccine passport implementation, unvaccinated people can cite that report as a reason for their refusal of the vaccine.

Tweeter implied that vaccinated people have also started casting doubts on vaccine effectiveness, and public health interventions because public health officials are thinking of changing definitions of fully vaxxed.
Tweeter shared a Daily Beast report about a Dutch COVID testing firm issuing phony vaccine certificates, implying that vaccine mandates might not work.
Tweeter implied that CDC does not consider people with two vaccine doses as fully vaccinated and their data on vaccine effectiveness is apparently wrong. But he provided link to a U.K. health report.
Tweeter is implying that vaccine mandates apparently have no scientific basis as it is enforced only when it suits an institution.

User claims death rates are higher due to risks from the vaccines. Unclear what death rate user is referring to as the tweet has been taken offline. References the pausing of Pfizer vaccine in people under 40, asking "what will we learn next?"
This post criticizes democrats, claiming they did not want the COVID19 vaccine when Trump was in power but changed their minds when Biden got elected.

A tweet in response to concern over lifting mandates. This user argues people ought to get used to COVID because it isn't going anywhere. This tweet supports reducing public health interventions at this stage.
A tweet concerned about the likelihood of a rise in cases because the government is lifting restrictions. It also expresses concern about businesses who don't enforce public health guidelines.
A tweet about Emerald Robinson and the idea the vaccine has a satanic bioluminescent tracker called "Luciferase" which gives Christians a satanic marker.
A tweet about a new vaccine production facility which is under construction in South Korea.
User claims that the Secretary of Defense was "threatening to discharge" service members that refused the vaccine. Actual clip shows a generally vague answer that does not seem threatening.
Tweet references fake data generated as part of a conspiracy theory and claims an individual is "responsible for Covid-19." Tagged as #vaccinescandal
Tweet is part of a thread criticizing lockdown protests in London. User compares crowds of anti-vaxxers to shambling, brain-dead zombies.
Tweet is from a local government official in India updating people on the number of vaccines given locally and how many samples have been tested.

A tweet calling out a police officer from Miami for comments he made in a conservative group chat, as well as his association with groups that are against mandates and public health interventions. The user is heavily critical of this cop and any person in power who is politically conservative and against mandates.

A tweet from a journalist who wrote a story for Huff Post about pharmacists selling ivermectin to people who were tricked by the conservative media. Within the story they write about how the FDA is not taking action to crack down on pharmacists who mislead people about alternative remedies.
Tweeter, a news website, is reporting on the Omicron variant and whether vaccines can fight it.
Tweeter implied that the lifting of some COVID restrictions by the UK government last year in the fall would not last long.

Link to a Yahoo news article about global life insurance payouts in the first nine months of 2021 compared to all of 2020. User is implying that the 2 billion dollar increase coincided with vaccine rollout and alluding to some sort of conspiracy about vaccine manufacturers and insurance companies.
This post criticizes Joe Rogan for having anti-vaxxer Robert Malone on his show. The post writes that Rogan was uncritical of Malone, who dismissed fact checking that shows vaccine safety.
A tweet about how an unvaccinated person died at 40 because misinformation made them hesitant to take the vaccine. This user urges people to get vaccinated and follow public health guidelines.
A tweet promoting Sputnik V's use in India. It says vaccines are safe, although Sputnik has not been approved by WHO.
A tweet searching for people to administer vaccines and COVID tests.
Local news report on an Israeli study that shows benefits to a fourth vaccine dose.

Link to a story about Novak Djokovic being barred from entering Australia due to vaccination status. From the I Paper, a digital news source based in the U.K
Tweet claims to be on the anti-mandate side, but disagrees with public protests because it "causes harm" and there are more effective ways to protest.
Tweet is a link to an article from a far right news source claiming the U.S government paid "corporate media" one billion dollars to "advertise vaccines"
Tweeter implied that since there is no exact and definite research on the long-term effects of the COVID vaccine, the vaccines are all experimental.
Tweeter implied that COVID 19 is apparently not so serious and public health officials are making an unnecessary fuss about it, asking people to get shots, which apparently do not work.

Tweeter is criticizing New York city's vaccine mandate because it prevented an unvaccinated basketball player from participating in the game but allowed him to watch the game from the courtside without a mask.
Tweeter is taunting vaccines by posting a link to an obscene video.

User appears to be a libertarian crowdsourcing a list of jobs that will not fire employees for refusing to get vaccinated. Assuming he left a not/wont out by accident, as the replies mostly list jobs with lax oversight or that can be done remotely.
Tweet facetiously calling for a study of how many people have "lost their sanity" while trying to discuss vaccines on twitter. Profile seems pro-vaccine.
This post criticizes the vaccinated for not wanting to be around people who are unvaccinated. It calls them stupid, and encourages them to read the literature on COVID19.

A tweet arguing that expecting a 100% vaccination rate in unrealistic. It also implies healthy people who got vaccinated were easily manipulated because they are afraid.

A tweet that allegedly shows people beating up the mayor of a Brazilian town because of vaccine mandates. The video actually shows a lawyer getting beat up because of a construction project. The attempt appears to be to spread the idea that the general population is against mandates and politicians who enforce them.

A tweet linking to an article containing every conspiracy theory you could think of; from making the vaccine intentionally deadly, to bluetooth, to nanotech connecting you to the 'Smart Grid'. This user seems to wholeheartedly believe these theories.

Tweet is citing language on the European Union's website from 2018 that mentions a potential vaccine passport system as evidence of a broader Covid conspiracy. Profile is strongly conservative libertarian, very anti government.
Tweet blames global vaccine inequality for prolonging the pandemic and allowing the virus to mutate.
Tweet claims it is impossible to know if a person died of the virus or the "spike [protein] in the vaccine"
Tweet is a link to an article from a far right news source claiming the U.S government paid "corporate media" one billion dollars to "advertise vaccines"
Tweeter is implying that the Australian government is tyrannical because it apparently quashes ideas that would challenge the government's policies on issues such as vaccination.
Tweeter is implying that vaccines are not effective since vaccinated people are also required to wear masks.
User seems to be baiting antivaxxers into admitting they were not coerced using force to get vaccinated and instead simply made a choice that was uncomfortable for them.

This post writes that vaccine mandates, including vaccine passports, are a means for the elite to create a global surveillance system. It also criticizes the Davos World Economic Forum and Central Banks.
This post shares a video about long COVID and the vaccine, and questions whether the data is similar with the tuberculosis vaccination.

A tweet arguing the vaccine is ineffective and Trump was a better president than Biden because more people have died during Biden's administration than during Trump's. This is misleading and untrue for various reasons.
A tweet expressing excitement at the prospect of no more mandates, it also criticises WA governor Jay Inslee for his public health policy.
A tweet including a video of a medical worker who does not want to get vaccinated and feels mandates are unreasonable considering they are so new there is no long-term data.

Tweet rebutting the argument that breakthrough infections mean the Covid vaccine is ineffective or not a real vaccine. References breakthrough cases of measles and polio in the early stages of those vaccination campaigns.
Tweet is reposting a link from the Congressional Research Service that explains how Covid vaccines are covered by previous public health legislation (PREP Act)

Tweet is responding to a thread that is nominally about political discourse, but mainly about vaccine skepticism. The person this user is replying to claims vaccines should not be politicized, but his profile leans anti-government and conservative in a devil's advocate kind of way.

A tweet arguing that it's too soon to open schools, at the time of the tweet, because there ought to be more intensive interventions implemented before kids can safely attend school. Ventilation, vaccinating younger students, etc.
Tweeter shared an article from the Epoch Times, a website that uses questionable sources, about the heart abnormalities following COVID vaccination to imply that the vaccines are apparently not safe.
Tweeter is implying that vaccine passport is preventing people from practicing their faith as many churches require proof of vaccination or negative testing to attend in-person services.
Tweeter is implying that COVID vaccines apparently do not work so it is pointless to sharing charts and data showing deaths from COVID vaccines.
This post shares an article from Lew Rockwell, a site known for fake news, about the so-called truth behind mandatory smallpox vaccinations.
Since the tweet is no longer live, its context is not clear. But it appears that tweeter is saying anything said against the vaccine cannot be considered hate speech.
Tweeter is implying that people who are refusing COVID vaccination might be using religion as an excuse if they had been vaccinated for other diseases before.
This post writes that mandatory vaccines are important but don’t stop a pandemic. It argues that low vaccinations can lead to uncontrolled spread and panic, making mandatory vaccines necessary.

Tweeter is implying that natural immunity is better than vaccine by quoting Dr. Anthony Fauci from 2018 before the pandemic happened. The context of the tweet is not clear as the original tweet has been suspended.

Tweeter implied that all of Bill Gates' philanthropic activities have profit motives and blamed Gates for prolonging the pandemic by apparently urging Oxford University to sell the IP of its COVID to AstraZeneca.
This post criticizes vaccine mandates and implies that being vaccinates does not protect others.
This tweeter announces that they have received the first dose of the COVID19 vaccine.

This post shares a graph of google searches for the keyword myocarditis. The tweeter argues that since searches only spiked one year into the pandemic, it is proof that the vaccines cause myocarditis, not COVID19 itself. Vaccine damage is being covered up, they write.
This post advocates for slowing down the COVID19 pandemic through vaccine equity and a global response. It includes a link to donate to the health activist group R2H Action.
Tweeter shared a piece of news last year in November about CDC advisers supporting that booster shots should be made available to all U.S. adults.
Tweeter shared a news report on Oklahoma's attorney general suing the Biden administration over its vaccine mandate.
This post criticizes the United States vaccination mandates, writing that because tennis player Novak Djokovic is unvaccinated, he will not be able to play in the Miami Open.
This tweet is by The Daily Beast about an unvaccinated person denied a heart transplant by a Boston Hospital.

In this post, member of congress Claudia Tenney criticizes Joe Biden for using the Occupational Safety and Health Administration to enforce vaccine mandates. She writes that Biden is overreaching and abusing power.

This post shares an article from the far-right news outlet the Gateway Pundit. It criticizes the Spokane Food Pantry for turning away people who don't have proof of vaccination or a negative COVID19 test.
criticism_other: Not allowing the unvaccinated into food banks

meaning: Tweeter implied that people refusing COVID vaccine were inoculated for other diseases in the past. Tweeter is replying to another tweet about proof of vaccination requirements in American schools in the 1970s.
This tweet is by U.K. Daily Mail about their report on the rate of vaccination in English soccer premier league is lower than in other major sports because of conspiracy theories.

Tweeter shared a non-peer-reviewed study on what extent people feel sick after receiving different brands of COVID vaccines. Although the study notes the importance of vaccination, the tweet can be misinterpreted.
This post includes the latest number of COVID19 cases and deaths in Victoria, Australia, writing that the high numbers are disappointing but that they would be worse without vaccinations.
In response to a tweet about elderly deaths due to COVID19, this post claims that booster shots are killing the elderly and criticizes continued vaccines mandates.
This post by CP24 News includes an article that announces people born between January and April can now download their vaccine certificates.

This post shares a quote from an article by the Washington Post. It writes that hospital administrators have said that vaccine mandates have worked, with noticeable drops in infections and sick leaves.
Tweeter is sharing a news report about a Texan medical institution sharing a COVID vaccine it developed with African nations.
Tweeter implied that COVID vaccines are not safe because tweeter's neighbour's uncle died of heart issues after vaccination, but tweeter does not mention if the uncle had an underlying condition.
Tweeter implied that Trump supporters would develop any conspiracy theory to justify their anti-vaccine stance.
This tweet is by Rebel News, which uses questionable sources, about Australia's Trucker's protest against the vaccine mandate influenced by the protest in Ottawa.
This post announces that Moderna has requested emergency authorization from the Food and Drug Administration to give adults over 18 its COVID19 booster shot.

Tweeter implied that the South African president is spending money to buy expensive vaccines instead of tackling the country's poverty because he is apparently in cahoots with the so-called evil vaccine manufacturers.
It is not clear if tweeter is against the vaccine mandate or not because she compares it with a similar requirement in the past.
Tweeter in her Feb 2022 shared a Forbes article from April 2020 about researchers warning that the COVID vaccines in development then could increase the risk of acquiring HIV.
Tweeter is implying that vaccine mandate is not being enforced properly and it will not be effective in preventing transmission of the virus.
Tweeter implied that vaccine mandates apparently killed more people because they got vaccinated in reply to a tweet on vaccine mandates increate the number of vaccinated people.

This post by True North Centre news shares an article about New Blue Party MPP Belinda Karahalios, who is against the Ontario government’s rule requiring anyone entering Queen’s Park to show proof of COVID19 vaccination or a negative test result.
This post writes that there are legitimate reasons for not being fully vaccinated, such as bad reactions to the first shot, preventing someone from getting a booster.
This post by Kyle Becker writes that vaccines were never meant to be safe and effective. It implies that vaccines are a hoax.

This post shares an article by the Daily Mail UK about lower antibody levels from the Moderna vaccine amid the Omicron variant. It writes that pharmaceutical companies may update their vaccines to be more effective against Omicron.

This post by a conspiracy theorist writes that the vaccinated defend mandatory COVID19 vaccines by listing other mandatory vaccines like polio. The post says this argument is moot because no other past vaccine needed so many booster shots.

This post criticizes military personnel refusing to get vaccinated. They argue that in basic military training, people receive many vaccines, especially when going overseas, and that it makes no sense to now refuse the COVID19 vaccine and get fired.
Tweeter is sharing Krispy Kreme's vaccine incentive program last year in which free doughnuts were given to vaccinated customers.
This post criticizes Doug Ford and the Ontario government, writing that they waited too long to implement vaccine certificates, putting restaurant, gym, and hospital workers at an unnecessary risk.
Tweeter is pointing at the contradictory policies of an NYC indoor mall where patrons are not required to wear a mask but require proof of vaccination to eat at the food court inside.
Tweeter is implying that COVID vaccine apparently causes COVID 19 by quoting a person who got COVID three times despite being vaccinated.
Tweeter is implying that President Biden is in cahoots with pharmaceutical companies and that is why he is not sharing the vaccine patent with developing countries.
This post announces that the United States is donating seventeen million doses of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine to the African Union.
This post from a suspended account writes that there is proof that COVID19 vaccines cause infection, hospitalization, and death, and that there is no proof the coronavirus causes COVID19.

This post criticizes the French government for being too strict with firing unvaccinated healthcare workers and implementing the vaccine passport. It also criticizes blaming the unvaccinated for the ongoing pandemic.

This post quotes Emerald Robinson, writing that the pandemic is a way for the government to control people. It says that mandatory vaccinations and vaccine passports force people into a social credit system.

This post links to an article by WBTW News 13 about the Republican Party's opposition to Joe Biden's vaccine mandates. It implies that Biden's aggressive approach is to blame for the country's division on vaccination.

This post criticized Joe Biden and the United States government, claiming they are hiding COVID19 vaccine side effects. It includes a screenshot of an announcement by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration about record keeping as proof.
This post argues that unvaccinated people promote the spread of COVID19 and of new mutations. It writes that we need to stop condoning people’s choice to remain unvaccinated.
criticism_other: Condoning people's choice to not vaccinate

meaning: This post by the Trinidad and Tobago Ministry of Health gives an update on COVID19 vaccination rollout and mass vaccination sites, including available vaccine brands and clinic locations.
A tweet criticising the Australian Prime Minister for how he handled the pandemic, especially for his reliance on the U.S and the Australian vaccine rollout.
A tweet about how "rare" breakthrough cases aren't so rare anymore, even when someone is up to date on their boosters.
This post writes that the vaccine passport is useless if paired with a negative COVID19 test and that none of the vaccine mandates are based on science. It is all political, they write.
This post writes that mutations of COVID19 have always been a possibility, even with vaccinations, and that people should not be in denial about this.
Tweeter implied that vaccine mandates are not new because vaccination for a number of diseases was required for children to go to schools.
Tweeter is implying that vaccines are apparently not effective if vaccinated children still have to wear masks at schools.

Tweeter is claiming that British immunology expert Robin Shattock lied about the vaccine's safety in a BBC program. Tweeter is propagating the disinformation that the mRNA technology was invented by one American scientist  Dr. Robert Malone.
MSNBC tweeted a report on Republican governors vowing to block Biden's vaccine mandate even though their state have vaccine mandate for other diseases for school going children.
Tweet is urging parents to demand proof that the vaccine is safe and effective instead of bowing to politicians and unions that say their children need to be vaccinated.

It's not clear if this tweet is anti-vaxx or not, yet it is clearly against democrats. The tweeter is misleading in saying that democrats caused confusion by not taking the vaccine, which is not true.

This anti-vaxx tweeter uses an FOI request issue to promote vaccine hesitancy. He says that because the FDA will not release vaccine test trials for 55 years, that people should question getting their booster.

This pro-vaccine tweeter made a thread about Fred Hampton, Chairman of the Illinois Chapter of the Black Panther. This tweet is one of many on this individual -- it indicates that Hampton was pro-vaccine and involved with free vaccination clinics.
This post shares a CTV News article about employer workplace vaccine mandates and Canada’s legal system.
This post tags the United States Food and Drug Administration recall account, asking if they can give a heads up when the COVID19 vaccine begins to be recalled.
A tweet asking people to pray the Supreme Court would make vaccine mandates illegal.
This post by White House COVID19 Data Director Cyrus Shahpar writes that according to a new CDC Data Tracker, booster shots maximize protection. It encourages people to get their shots now.

This post by FOX News San Diego writes that mRNA vaccines are the most effective. It says that those who received the single Johnson & Johnson shot are at a higher risk of serious illness and hospitalization than those who received an mRNA vaccine.
Tweeter shared a link from Canada's history museum to show that vaccine mandates have been used in the past to prevent the transmission of diseases such as smallpox.

Tweeter implied that people will apparently never trust public health authorities, democrats and media even after the pandemic because media apparently did not cover the real problems of lockdowns and vaccines.
Tweeter shared a NBC article about the number of pregnant women who died from COVID 19 in the USA to urge people to vaccinate against the virus.

Tweeter implied that vaccine mandates would not reduce transmission but hurt small businesses that have been struggling to survive due to the pandemic,  promote discrimination, and encroach on people's privacy.
Link to a CBC article about a doctor counter-protesting antivaxxers at the hospital he works at in Toronto.
support_other: Health care workers and medical professionals

meaning: This tweeter is not really promoting vaccines, but they are not against them. They say that a small percentage of people will suffer adverse affects to vaccines, which is true, but there is not enough information here to fill this information in more clearly.
A tweet criticising a bill in Oklahoma which would ban teachers from teaching anything that isn't in the Bible, especially since it would include vaccines and health science.
A tweet about how people ought to just get COVID and develop natural immunity, it also criticises health policies for violating people's privacy and freedom.

In response to a post by someone who is fully vaccinated and almost got COVID, this tweeter sarcastically writes that they almost got vaccinated because they went to the doctor and there COVID19 vaccines present.
This tweeter writes that they never had the chicken pox because they are vaccinated against them.

This tweeter writes how happy they were to get vaccinated against COVID19 and how proud they feel to be protecting their friends and community. They encourage those who are vaccinated to feel proud, too.

This post is in favour of the right to choose whether to get vaccinated against COVID19, except for children, writing that because they don’t know of any children dying from COVID19 or the vaccine, there is no point in vaccinating them.

A tweet from a CBC reporter about how a public health official avoided questions about a statement made by the premier about how the vaccine doesn't prevent transmission. This tweet supports the fact that the vaccine prevents some transmission.
Tweeter is implying that U.K. should have done better in making booster shots available to its population during the summer of 2021 to prevent COVID fatalities.
Tweeter is implying that anti-vaxxers wrongly interpret the effectiveness of vaccines, which are never 100 percent effective.
Tweeter implied that the atrocities committed against Jews cannot be equated to the restrictions unvaccinated people are facing in certain public settings.
