Tweeter implied that people got vaccinated not to protect themselves from COVID but to protect their jobs. She claimed many vaccinated people participated in the Ottawa protest to support freedom of choice.
Tweeter implied that COVID vaccines do not work because they are apparently not vaccines but gene injections by posting a TV report from a questionable source about a surge in COVID cases in Israel.
Tweeter implied that the heart attack in a vaccinated person was apparently caused by the COVID vaccine and shared a post from the Telegram app.

This pro-vaccine tweeter replied to an anti-vaxxer, to ask them how they could have seen an ICU -- as well as the effects of the vaccine -- while they're restricted. The other tweeter's posts were deleted so it's not clear what they said.
Tweeter implied that governments around the world were wrong in trying to control the spread of COVID by imposing lockdowns, mandating masks, and vaccines.
This pro-vaccine tweeter declared that she just scheduled her third vaccine appointment.

This anti-vaxxer says that VAERS reported a ton of deaths and adverse effects. VAERS does not verify the claims that are made to their platform and even if this tweeter's numbers are accurate, it doesn't mean much about the reality of the situation.
It seems that tweeter implied that he and his buddies could ignore social distancing after getting vaccinated.

This anti-vaxxer is upset that fetal cells are involved in vaccines. This fact tends to be exaggerated by religious people. Immunize BC says that "Some vaccines are made by growing the vaccine viruses in human fetal cell lines. However, the vaccines themselves do not contain fetal cells or tissue." This tweeter also seems to criticize media by saying they only give half of the story to the public.
criticism_other: Use of fetal cells in vaccines

meaning: Tweeter is congratulating an NHS doctor for her job in promoting vaccination.
This tweet is by the United Health Care Workers of Ontario opposing the vaccine mandate by claiming that COVID vaccines are not safe and effective.
Tweeter is implying that people should back their general statements about vaccines not being effective and safe with scientific evidence and data.
Tweeter implied that anti-vaxxers are refusing vaccines because of spiteful virtue signaling.

Tweeter is propagating the misinformation that COVID vaccines can lead to HIV by posting tweets about a French scientist, who discovered HIV but later turned controversial for reasons including his anti-vaccine stance.
This anti-vaxxer claims that they have several loved ones who were injured by the vaccine. They did not provide proof of this. The tweeter also accused The Guardian of promoting "fear propaganda."
Tweeter implied that his physician colleagues only got vaccinated to remain working in healthcare but it is hydroxychloroquine that is keeping tweeter and his colleagues safe from COVID infection.

This tweeter posted a Bloomberg news article, which reported that vaccines could be in short supply in the U.S. due to the possibility of lack of funding. The tweeter also mentions that an order of monoclonal antibody treatments was a possibility.
criticism_other: Lack of funding for vaccines, vaccine equity

meaning: This conspiracy theorist says that vaccines are mean to control the human race by re-writing DNA. He also says that the illuminati and dark forces of the universe are using vaccines to enslave people.
Tweeter implied that vaccines are not effective in preventing COVID infection by posting a piece of news about singer Bryan Adams testing positive for COVID twice, even though he is fully vaccinated.
Tweeter implied that if anti-vaxxers are de-platformed for spreading misinformation then MSNBC host Rachel Maddow should be too for saying that vaccinated cannot spread the virus.
This pro-vaccine tweeter says she's vaccinated and asks why mandatory vaccination was not instated more urgently in Germany. She says that if vaccines save lives, why not instate it immediately.
Tweeter implied that governments were wrong to enforce mask and vaccine mandates.
Tweeter is implying that governments did not need to roll out vaccines because vaccines apparently do not work.
The tweeter says they are getting their vaccine tomorrow.
This tweeter is anti-vaxx because he's asking a friend if it's possible to go to Thailand while unvaccinated. This implies that either he, or his friend, are unvaccinated.
This anti-vaxxer is calling out politicians who he's angry at because they were too late to protest vaccine mandates. This tweeter says they were a year too late and that he will remember that.

This anti-vaxxer blames Trudeau for travel restrictions preventing her from going abroad to see a sick family member. She is not vaccinated and calls vaccinated people carriers of "the plague" which is misleading.
criticism_other: Trudeau, Travel Bans for the unvaccinated

meaning: This tweet promotes Joe Rogan and says that he does tell some people to get the vaccine. Joe Rogan has said in news outlets that he supports vaccination and tried to get vaccinated, but his message is mixed while he promotes other questionable ideas.
This tweeter promotes vaccine mandates. She hopes that schools will instate them as well.
support_other: Schools adding vaccine mandates to their lists

meaning: This pro-vaccine tweeter is defending vaccines. Their tweet replies to an anti-vaxxer. They say that Pfizer was not part of an "operation warp speed." And that it was developed in Germany and widely used in the U.S.
Tweeter is promoting her websites which aggregates news on different topics including vaccines.
Tweeter implied that many human beings died from COVID because they did not get vaccinated or wear masks but no human life is ended through abortions.
Tweeter is expressing his anger at another user who opposed the vaccine mandate for healthcare workers and called it illogical.
An article from the Huffington Post explaining that Scorpios had the lowest vaccination rates.
The tweet is hateful towards muslim migrants and refugees. It also promotes misinformation by saying Europeans and white people are forced to get vaccinated to make them infertile.

This tweet is anti-vaxx because he's posting a Rebel News article without rejecting what they're saying. Rebel News is a far-right outlet, with questionable fact-checking. The article contained in this post claims that CN rail workers were trying to sue the "feds" for vaccine mandates.
This anti-vaxxer is anti-vaxx, based on his wall. He's posting a right-wing article here about BIDEN, and how vaccine mandates may not go through.

Tweeter is asking about the disinformation that Pfizer vaccines contain fetal cells in a reply to another tweeter who posted that Project Veritas, the far-right disinformation propagation group, should not be trusted.

This tweeter posted anti-mask information on his blog, stating that although the vaccine mandates were lifted in New York, "children under the age of five [will still be 'force-masked' because they are ‘not yet eligible for vaccination.’"

This anti-vaxx tweeter posted information about an ex contractor involved in the Pfizer trials blowing the whistle on something they felt was unsafe about the trials. 

CBS17 reported that there was no need for the public to worry. They investigated this story and found that "The employee... told the publication that some paperwork may have been left out in the open, potentially unblinding some of the participants. Among her other concerns: Participants were not properly monitored by clinical staff after their injections, vaccines not being stored at the right temperature and mislabeling of specimens."
Tweeter implied that COVID vaccines do not work by posting a tweeter survey he conducted where most people claimed they did not get infected even though they are unvaccinated.
Tweeter is sharing his long COVID experience with another user who faced a similar fate.
Tweeter shared a news report about violent vaccine mandate protestors in New York.
The tweeter questions how public health policies have originated and criticize that people have only being offering information about the origins of the virus.
The tweeter, an account from New Zealand, shares an article to encourage people to get vaccinated.

This journalist is sharing a study about face mask use and its necessity before and after vaccination. It's not clear if the study this tweeter posted is peer reviewed, but the tweeter is definitely pro-public mandate. She highlighted this quote in her thread: "The results of this study re-emphasise that vaccination alone is not enough to control the pandemic & prevent deaths and suffering..."
This tweeter is likely replying to an anti-vaxxer whose post is now deleted. They say that we would be in the year 1918 if we didn't have vaccines.
Tweeter implied that COVID 19 vaccines are not safe and claimed the vaccines kill people so the U.S.A.'s Food and Drug administration should be charged with murder.
Tweeter, an Australian priest, implied that vaccination may not be easily accessible for people in his locality. They have to make travel arrangements to get vaccinated.

Tweet compares discrimination/sanction of Russians in the war in Ukraine to discrimination against anti-vaxxers. Claims most Ukrainians are unvaxxed and yet receive support from the West, which is hypocritical and an example of "virtue signalling." Additional comparison to discrimination against Russians and the BLM movement. Overall, tweet is a general attempt to tie the anti-vax cause to current geopolitics.

This tweet is in reply to an anti-vaxxer who claimed that vaccine mandates turn patrons away from live music events. This tweeter corrected them and said that this show they attended recently was packed full, and a vaccine mandate was in place. They posted a picture to prove it.

This post criticizes the Centres for Disease Control Director for admitting that the COVID19 vaccine is not as effective as she originally claimed. The post implies that this proves there is something wrong with the vaccine.
A retweet of an article about COVID-19 policies for the special olympics. The tweeter has also tagged the Governor of Florida.
This is a tweet from Australia's president, Scott Morrison. He says he's happy to be such strong friends with the U.K. and he celebrates their vaccine swap deal.
It's not clear what this tweeter is promoting or criticizing because the tweet they're replying to was deactivated. But they asking people if they think vaccines are of any use.
This tweeter celebrates New Zealand for their pre-vaccine pandemic response. She's clearly pro-mandate.
This tweet is by Saskatchewan health authority informing the public of the pregnancy and high risk of COVID-19 to encourage pregnant women to vaccinate.
This is a vaccine promotion advertisement by a regional NHS body in the U.K.
Tweeter implied that vaccines are not safe by posting a news report about British rock musician Zion's death from complications of the AstraZeneca COVID vaccine jab.
Tweet is praising Sydney lifting restrictions for unvaccinated Australians after lifting restrictions on vaccinated citizens months earlier. Reference to"overbearing Covid police"
This tweeter is not clearly pro-vaccine, rather he promotes consistent messaging. He is a journalist and says that changes in vaccination recommendations may contribute to vaccine hesitancy.
A journalist from Fox News bragging to Joe Biden that the court halted mandatory vaccine for private companies.
The tweeter insinuates the democrats leaked a vaccine scandal to win the election.

This tweeter posts a quote that says data shows that vaccines reduce the risk of death or serious illness. The tweeter posted a link to a med science article which discusses how Florida's surgeon general is "bucking" the recommendations of science.
The tweeter is criticizing the UK media for not covering the "lies, distortions and propaganda" being shared about the COVID-19 pandemic and vaccines.
Tweet is from the government of PEI encouraging people to get their second doses and booster shots as soon as appointments are available.

User argues that one-way masking is effective in preventing Covid because "doctors do it all the time." User also claims that disabled people are not disproportionately affected by the pandemic because most of them are vaccinated. Unclear which disabilities or illnesses are being referred to.
Tweeter shared a link and a graph showing how vaccine effectiveness can be increased through booster doses as the first two jabs' efficacy wanes over time against different variants.

Tweeter, a South African epidemiologist, implied that not all data related to vaccination in the country is easily accessible to the public, since the national health department releases curated data.
Tweeter seems to conduct a Twitter survey to find out if some people got vaccinated merely because of the vaccine mandate.

Tweet is from an Australian PhD specializing in mould and air quality pulling from the Vaccine Adverse Events Reporting System about the covid vaccine causing "depleted lymphocytes. "Page has several retweets from other antivax doctors, Robert F Kennedy Jr, and references to Bill Gates and "the Great Reset"

This pro-vaccine tweeter posted a Daily Beast link about a man who wants to arrest democrats. He's anti-vaxx and wears a "vaccine police" t-shirt. The tweeter appears to be posting this type of content on her wall frequently to raise the alarm to far-right activists.
criticism_other: Far-right members who want to do citizens arrests on democrats

meaning: The tweeter is upset that the COVID-19 vaccine does not make people immune to seizures.
The tweeter insinuates China was having a nationwide outbreak due to the ineffectiveness of "Chinese vaccines."

Tweet is a recap of an anti-vaccine protest in Bulgaria. While the tweet itself is not opinionated one way or another, the users page contains links to anti-globalist, anti-elite, conservative politicians, climate change deniers, and conspiracy theories about governments using artificial intelligence to force compliance.
User claims masks and vaccines are not necessary for children.
Tweeter is implying that COVID vaccines do not work because an outbreak occurred on a cruise ship which ensured everyone onboard was vaccinated and tested negative for COVID 19.
Tweeter is implying that if everyone continues to get vaccinated then governments will not impose lockdowns.

This post shares a tweet that celebrates the effectiveness of the Moderna combination vaccine. It celebrates that mRNA vaccines could prevent a wide array of diseases in cheaper, easier, and more effective ways.
This post by healthcare company GlucoRx announces the hours and location of their COVID19 vaccine clinic, including a link to book a vaccination appointment.
This post criticizes the Daily Mail for pushing COVID19 vaccines.
Tweeter seems to imply that people practicing good hygiene will not require vaccines to protect themselves from COVID 19 and flu, but tweeter does not mention that COVID 19 can be airborne.
Tweet is from the official ABC news account. It is a link to a story about healthcare workers being suspended or fired for refusing to get the vaccine.
Tweet is a link to a news article about PM Modi taking credit for shipping millions of vaccine doses to other countries during the Davos summit.

This tweeter is arguing within a thread with an anti-vaxxer who claims that there's no vaccine for COVID-19. This tweeter says there is actually a vaccine for COVID-19. He asks the anti-vaxxer if they would take a vaccine if it existed for COVID-19, given that it does exist.

This tweeter is pro-vaccine because her wall contains more obvious pro-vaxx tweets. This specific tweet is not so clear in this meaning, but she seems to be saying that anti-vaxxers wouldn't get her jokes about vaccines.
The tweeter shares an article about a professor who criticized a politician for being an anti-vaxxer.
Tweet is a headline from CNBC about Biden's pandemic rhetoric before imposing the mandatory vaccination of federal workers.

Tweet appears to be a right-wing comedian "trolling" the Mayor of Dallas by begging him to mandate vaccines, give free tacos to Latinx people who get vaccinated, hold drag events with free vaccination for the gay community, etc. He also claims he has two children on puberty blockers and those were easier to get than the vaccine. He repeatedly mentions how hard it is for his kids to keep seeing their housekeepers/staff die of Covid. Pretty sure the whole thing was satire and he doesn't actually have kids, but its hard to find concrete information. He is a contributor to Blaze TV and has been a guest on Tucker Carlson's show as well.
This tweet is by a Malaysian news website reporting that Malaysian who receive two doses of the Sinovac vaccine have to get a booster dose to qualify as fully vaccinated.
Tweeter, a republican supporter, implied that American mainstream media does not want to publish anti-vaccine stance news, although the news appeared in the New York Times.
This post criticizes France for deactivating millions of COVID19 vaccine passports months before their expiration date, a decision made to force people to get booster shots sooner.

This post criticizes Justin Trudeau’s twitter posts, writing that he needs to learn about COVID19 vaccine side effects and harms and that his public messaging needs to recognize that vaccines are imperfect.
This post by the United Nations Volunteer Programme shares an article about Nairobi volunteer Lucas Odhiambo, who celebrates the efforts of UNICEF and its partners to accelerate vaccine access.

This specific tweet is clarifying information about vaccine mandates. Although this exact tweet doesn't really promote or criticize, rather it simply provides information, this tweeter has a lot of pro-vaccine information on her thread.

Fox News took an anti-mandate approach throughout much of their coverage of the pandemic, therefore this post is anti-vaccine. This post features one of their reports about how a group of fire fighters are trying to sue a governor over vaccine mandates.
The tweeter is upset about mandatory vaccine and COVID-19 mandates.
The tweeter is criticizing the government for being "above god" by forcing people to get vaccinated.
User is tweeting about an anti-vaccine protest in Victoria BC, claiming vaccine mandates are "segregation" and "normal Canadians are tired of medical tyranny"

Tweeter is countering disinformation that President Biden is pushing vaccines across the border to gain global control, by noting he is partnering with WHO to ensure the global distribution of vaccines.
Tweeter is implying that COVID vaccines and other vaccines saves children from harmful diseases.

This post shares a video about Nicki Minaj being banned by twitter after discussing anti-vaccine views. It supports Nicki, saying that she is right and all other experts are wrong. It also says that the data shows that the COVID19 vaccine causes testicular swelling.
This tweet criticizes the COVID19 vaccine, arguing many people die every year but this does not mean we should get a vaccine for everything.

This post criticizes mainstream media including Medium for contributing to the smear campaign against Ivermectin. It argues that this is dangerous to democracy and that mainstream media needs to look into censorship, vaccine issues, and early treatment.

This post criticizes a tweet thread about claims that people could die from the COVID19 vaccine or booster shot. It writes that we should not claim others will die because death is more complicated than getting the vaccine.

Tweeter is implying the COVID 19 precautionary measures are all mutually exclusive and enforcement of one does not require any other measures in place. But tweeter ignores the effectiveness of a combination of measures.
This tweet is an Indian media website quoting a minister about the Indian government's success with vaccination and how the opposition party allegedly dissuaded people from getting the jab.
This post by an anti-vaxxer claims that Chinese laboratories are responsible for COVID19 and will release more diseases. It also writes that the COVID19 vaccine is causing depopulation.

This post shares an article by Court House News about the Florida governor Ron DeSantis signing sweeping laws against vaccine and mask mandates, writing that this has led to high death rates in Florida amid the Omicron surge.

This post criticizes the new governor of Virginia for planning to ban masks for children and being weak on fighting COVID19. It criticizes Republicans in the United States broadly, and promotes vaccination.

This post is in favour of vaccinating children against COVID19, writing that it slows the spread of the disease to their grandparents. We have a duty to stop the spread broadly, like we do with the flu, it says.
support_other: Doing your part to protect the community

meaning: The tweeter is making fun of anti-vaxxers who were unable to protest and later enter a restaurant.
The tweeter is spreading misinformation by saying variants of COVID-19 are just public health officials lying about failed vaccines.
The tweeter shares an article that says there is an EU COVID certificate which bears the name Adolf Hitler. The news source, however, seems unreliable.

This tweeter criticizes doctors, vaccine effectiveness, and vaccine mandates. She writes that her cousin’s doctors refuse to discuss COVID19 vaccine effects with her after she got COVID despite being vaccinated at the doctors’ insistence. It also promotes medication for COVID19 as a safer option than vaccines.
This post criticizes the lockdown and mandatory COVID19 vaccinations in Austria, writing that this is not effective and will lead to revolting and bloodshed.

This post shares a Wall Street Journal article about how lockdowns and mandatory vaccinations have helped convince the unvaccinated in Austria to get the COVID19 shot during the Omicron wave. The post celebrates using negative consequences rather than gentle tactics as a way to persuade anti-vaxxers.

This tweeter is pro-vaccine based on other posts within this thread. This specific tweet shows a picture of someone sleeping at a desk, meaning they're a bad student who doesn't get what's going on. And the text of the tweet says that we made vaccines by isolating the virus.
The tweeter is criticizing people who try to encourage others to get vaccinated. The tweeter also justifies their position because they have not been hospitalized during the pandemic.
The tweeter is encouraging people to get vaccinated.

This tweeter criticizes COVID19 vaccine mandates, the United States government, and Joe Biden. They write that they got vaccinated because of the mandates and now that the mandates are lifted, they plan to sue the government and their employer.
This post criticizes Donald Trump for repeating misinformation about COVID19 that he heard on Fox News. It says that Trump is attempting to make white men seem suppressed through misinformation.

This post is in favour of firing unvaccinated staff. It explains that in Washington State, all employees are required to be vaccinated against COVID19, which is why coaches at Washington State University have been fired.

This post shares a list of the side effects of the Pfizer COVID19 vaccine, including epilepsy, hepatitis, blood clots, brain swelling, lupus, and arthritis. It writes that the vaccine is unsafe and that pharmaceutical companies and the FDA are untrustworthy.

This post promotes COVID19 testing but criticizes the lack of attention given to adverse effects from vaccination, writing that immunity and efficacy vary by individual. Their child got Costochondritis after getting vaccinated, they write.

This post by comedian Chip Franklin writes that the founder of an evangelical television network who opposed COVID19 vaccines has died of the coronavirus. The posts asks his followers how they feel about this.

This post claims that public health authorities are killing people through NIH-funded superviruses, vaccines that cause antibody dependent evolution, and propaganda against early treatment of COVID19.

This post shares a link to an article from Expose News, a known misinformation site, claiming that the Pfizer COVID19 vaccine kills more people than it saves. It also calls for a stop to fear mongering, dictatorship, and the great reset.

This post by healthcare publisher OncLive shares an article about a scientific study that found that the Bacillus Calmette–Guérin vaccine Panvac did not significantly improve clinical outcomes for patients with certain bladder cancers.
The tweeter is spreading misinformation by sharing a post that states the vaccine is being used for experimental gene therapy.
The tweeter is discussing that people who are vaccinated have milder cases of COVID-19. However, it is difficult to tell if the tweeter is being sarcastic or not.
The tweeter is spreading misinformation by sharing that Anthony Fauci told Mark Zuckerberg that vaccines are making things worse. Twitter has a note beside the tweet saying that it's wrong.

This post criticizes the Australia Open for not allowing Novak Djokovic to play due to not getting the COVID19 vaccine. The tennis player received a valid document inviting him to Australia, writes the post, so he should be allowed to compete.

This post shares a news article from the journal Nature about scientific studies questioning the length of protection offered by China’s CoronaVac and Sinopharm vaccines. It writes that COVID19 vaccines are now being approved for boosters to maintain their effectiveness over time.

This post criticizes journalist Robert Peston for questioning how rare he is for getting COVID19 while being double vaccinated. It writes that vaccines prevent serious illness but clearly not infection.
This post criticizes the unvaccinated, writing that it does not make sense to not take a vaccine that minimizes sickness and likelihood of transmitting COVID19.
This post criticizes the vaccinated, writing that they cannot admit that something is badly wrong with the COVID19 vaccine.
This post criticizes anti-vaxxers on twitter who claim that COVID19 vaccine ingredients are kept from the public. It shares a link to a NHS webpage that lists each vaccine brand’s ingredients.
This post argues that there have been many articles lately about triggers for heart attacks and strokes, but that none of these mention vaccines as possible causes.
This post criticizes Boris Johnson for deliberately lying to provoke anti-vaxxers to be violent.

This post argues that masking and vaccinations are not sufficient for protecting the most vulnerable from COVID19. Masking, they write, has been shown to do nothing. They call for using other methods.
This post criticizes the COVID19 vaccination cards in Ghana, complaining that they show an error when they’re scanned.

This post promotes India’s COVAXIN vaccine, writing that it is more effective than the mRNA vaccines Pfizer and Moderna being used in the United States, France, and Germany. It criticizes the National Institutes of Health (NIH) Director Lawrence Tabak for promoting mRNA vaccines.
The tweeter is making fun of an account meant to support people and their general health by saying they are just promoting vaccines.
The tweeter spreads misinformation by saying a public official, who is unidentifiable, should be tried for war crimes because they support a vaccine that is unsafe and not FDA approved.
This tweet by a conspiracy theory account includes a link to a video from an unsafe website, very likely sharing misinformation about COVID19 vaccines, lockdowns, and science.

This post criticizes the University of Arkansas for not requiring masks or COVID19 vaccines on campus, including at sports games. It encourages people to stay home to watch sports games rather than attend in person.
This post shares a link to a petition for fast-tracking the rollout of COVID19 vaccines for five- to eleven-year-olds in the United Kingdom, writing that they wished the petition had more signatures.
This tweeter refuses to get the COVID19 vaccine. The post includes a link to a page that shows why they are not getting the vaccine, but the link is broken and impossible to view.

This post emphasizes risks of the COVID19 vaccine, including VAED and VAERD as well as unknown effectiveness in pregnant and lactating women, and children under twelve. It implies that this information is confidential and being kept from the public.
This post writes that someone died from the vaccine.

This post criticizes Boris Johnson and vaccine passports in the United Kingdom. It writes that through deception and stealth, vaccine passports are being rolled out with care home workers to test its effectiveness.
This post quotes Marco Cavaleri, EMA head of biological threats and vaccines strategy, saying that COVID19 booster shots can be done once or twice but are unlikely to be repeated constantly.

This post criticizes the wording of a tweet about a COVID19 surge in China, writing that it is important to note that the outbreak is not caused by a new virus, but rather by a new variant of the same virus – Omicron.
This tweeter writes that they will not be able to create YouTube content this week because they are recovering from side effects of the Pfizer COVID19 vaccine.
This post by a physician announces that the Health Service Executive in Ireland is providing COVID19 vaccinations at the antenatal clinic in Coombe Hospital.
Tweeter implied that investors should be concerned that a biopharmaceutical company is investing in COVID vaccines rather than cancer research.
By sharing an article about COVID-19 infection and possibility of erectile dysfunction, Tweeter is trying to encourage men to get vaccinated.

This post criticizes the COVID19 vaccine and writes that monoclonal antibodies are the better option. It also criticizes the availability of monoclonal antibodies, questioning why Trump got them almost one year ago but they’re still not available for average citizens.

In response to a post about a someone who is triple-vaccinated and still got COVID19, this tweeter writes that they have been telling people for ages that the vaccine does not prevent infection and could make people more susceptible.
This post celebrates COVID19 vaccinations as vital for fighting the pandemic. It encourages people to get vaccinated for the wellbeing of society.

This post argues that we do not know what long-term risks the COVID19 vaccine will bring, if any, just as we do not know the long term risks and complications from contracting COVID19. It is in favour of the vaccine and appears to reply to an anti-vaxxer post from a suspended account.
Tweeter appears to deny that there is a pandemic and thus people do not need to get vaccinated to protect themselves from any disease.
Tweeter is implying that vaccine mandates enforced in private places are a way to discriminate against certain groups of people.
Tweeter shared an article by Byline Times, a British news website, about the British politicians partying during lockdowns even before vaccination started in the U.K.
The context is unclear, but the tweeter seems to be criticizing the government and public health officials over vaccine mandates and safety.
By sharing the news that Japan added myocarditis to its list of clinically severe adverse drug reactions to the Pfizer and Moderna vaccine, tweeter implied that all COVID vaccines are not safe.
The tweeter questions vaccine effectiveness since cases are rising even with most of the Australia having two vaccines.
This post is part of a thread that argues that vaccination against COVID19 gives partial immunity and should be a last line of defence against the virus.

This post criticizes employers in Australia for firing unvaccinated employees. It shares a link to a cease and desist warning, encouraging people to download it and present it to employers attempting to dismiss employees for non-compliance.
In response to a tweet about plummeting stocks, this post writes that the Pfizer stock is unlikely to recover because demand for COVID19 vaccines is dying down.
This post by the Victorian Department of Health in Australia announces the availability of COVID19 vaccines for five- to eleven-year-olds. It encourages people to book an appointment online.
This post claims that a geopolitical economist he spoke with confirmed that a social credit system is coming to North America and that the vaccine passport is the beginning and will never go away.
Tweeter shared a link to a video where a doctor talks with a former President Bush aide about the effectiveness of vaccines and how vaccine mandates are tools by governments to control its citizen.
This post by CBC News announces that mixed doses of COVID19 vaccine booster shots have been approved in the United States.
This post calls for normalizing sharing COVID19 vaccination status when planning to meet up with people. It suggests casually mentioning one’s vaccination status before getting together.
By sharing a Twitter thread showing social media posts by different Western Australians, Tweeter is mocking them for supporting vaccines and their government for implementing COVID restrictions.
Tweeter is laughing at the Botswana government's vaccine mandate rules, implying that governments implement illogical COVID vaccine policies in the name of science.
The tweeter shares an article with information about vaccines with a comment about how often information changes amid the pandemic.
This is an informational tweet by a healthcare organization in Northern Ireland on mass vaccination clinics.
Tweeter implied that governments are calling for mass vaccination only to apparently control people through vaccine passports.

This post claims that US Vice-President Kamala Harris said the COVID19 vaccine was not worth it and refused to take it because Trump got it so quickly. It also writes that someone who was triple vaccinated still got sick, undermining the vaccine's effectiveness.
This post by a vaccine scientist celebrates an international partnership to increase global vaccine equity.
This post announces the vaccination statistics for December 14, 2021 in Hong Kong, including first doses, comparisons to weeks prior, and estimated rates for the end of the year.
This post makes fun of Germany’s Health Minister for allegedly falling asleep during a press conference. The post makes a point of mentioning that the minister is fully vaccinated.

This post criticizes a video made by the Department of Health and Social Care in the United Kingdom about children feeling confident they won’t catch COVID19 after getting vaccinated. The vaccine doesn’t stop transmission, writes the post.

In response to an article about United Airlines turning their planes into premium and first class seating, this tweet writes that those planes likely wont have vaccine or mask mandates. It implies a criticism of the capitalistic nature of air travel.
This tweet is by a news website about a Canadian hockey player expressing his frustration about the vaccine mandate.
Tweeter implied that the American government should have been more strict about vaccination and kept the schools closed to prevent community transmission last November.
This post celebrates the New York Fire Department’s President for wanting to fight COVID19 vaccine mandates, and refusing to enforce the mandate among his members.

Tweeter shared an article from a website that uses questionable sources to claim that COVID vaccines apparently killed thousands in America and over 10 million people in India without providing any basis for the data.
Tweeter posted a link to a video of a police officer quitting his job over Washington state's vaccine mandate implying that it is creating a lot of anger among people towards the American government.
Tweeter implied that people in ICUs in a Nevada hospital are all unvaccinated because all the vaccinated people have apparently died immediately after receiving the COVID vaccines.
The tweet is incoherent; however, it seems like the tweeter is criticizing vaccines and ventilation machines. The tweeter also mentions people putting bleach in pills and estrogen in horse pee.

This post claims that there is an overreaction to the COVID19 pandemic. Recovery rates are at 99% and symptoms are mild, they write. The post also criticizes mainstream media and Moderna for saying we need a vaccine.
This post claims that we are in a dictatorship where laws don’t matter and that vaccine commercials are failing to disclose side effects.
This post shares a link to a vaccine passport lawsuit website that appears to contain misinformation. The post writes that this is our last chance to save the human race, and calls for donations.

This post criticizes far-right conspiracy theorists who spread misinformation. It shares a link to an article by The Southern Cross that calls out anti-lockdown protestors for sharing disinformation and causing vaccine hesitancy.
This post supports Donald Trump, writing that he got the COVID19 vaccine to market in record time, all while people attempted to falsely impeach him. The tweeter is, however, also anti-vaccine.
This post celebrates COVID19 vaccination rates in India, providing the latest statistics and doses administered. It also links to a press release by the Government of India.
Tweeter implied that Indian states governed by parties other than the ruling BJP allegedly failed to vaccinate their population. Tweeter is praising Modi for doing a better job.
This tweet is by a Arts Centre tweeting about their COVID vaccine policy.
The tweeter claims vaccine certificates are a distraction. They also share an opinion article about how certificates are discriminatory and should not be extended.
Tweeter is implying that governments are trying to vaccinate people with COVID vaccines, which were apparently tested on animals, and the vaccines killed the animals.
The tweeter signed a petition to allow vaccines for children aged five to 11.
The tweeter asks "Do you trust the COVID-19 vaccine?"
The tweeter spreads misinformation by saying vaccines are used to depopulate, sterilize and make people sick. The tweeter also compares vaccinations to Nazi Germany.
The tweeter spreads misinformation by providing a phone number, which he claims people can use in WhatsApp to receive a vaccine certificate.
The tweeter encourages people to support artists against the vaccine. The tweeter says receiving the vaccine should be an individual's choice after they conduct their own research.
The tweeter expresses no interest in people getting fired from their jobs for being unvaccinated.

This post criticizes those defending Kyrie Irving’s choice not to get the COVID19 vaccine. It argues that New York State has had vaccine mandates for eighty years and that everyone has had to take several vaccines to go to school.
Reuters shares an article about U.S. pastors and advocacy groups who are mobilizing against COVID-19 vaccine mandates.
This post criticizes an anti-vaxxer for not understanding COVID19 side effects. It writes that the rates of myocarditis are higher in people that catch COVID19 than in those that get the vaccine.
This post from the Manchester City Council announces that a walk in centre is open in Moss Side for people to come and get their free COVID19 vaccines or boosters.
The tweeter indirectly criticizes someone else who suggests that vaccinations are linked to Nazi Germany and genocide.
The tweeter, who is journalist, reports Mike Parson, governor of Missouri, issued an executive order against forcing employees to get vaccinated as long as they have a religious or medical reason.
This tweet by comedian Cyrus McQueen criticizes Novak Djokovic and his anti-vaxx stance.

This post criticizes a tweeter who questioned what will be done about the unvaccinated who continue to come to work. It argues that the tweeter should stop worrying about other people’s life choices and just get boosted if she chooses to.

This post shares a news article that goes to a broken link, about a federal government whistleblower going public with secret recordings that claim to prove the government is hiding adverse effects of the COVID19 vaccine and that the vaccine is not legitimate.

This post blames Joe Biden for allegedly trying to destroy the United States. It writes that he shut down the Keystone pipeline, and forced COVID19 vaccine mandates, leading to supply chain breakdowns.

This post shares a New York Times article about anti-vaxxers who have embraced antibody treatments. The post says that the anti-vaxxer movement has been created by Big Pharma to profit from treatment and hospitalization, which is more lucrative than prevention.
The tweet is in response to another post of anti-vaxxer who was pepper sprayed during the trucker protests in Ottawa. The tweeter jokes that the protestor was sprayed with the COVID-19 vaccine.
The tweeter blames the Biden administration for gas prices, inflation, supply shortages, war and negative side effects of the COVID-19 vaccine.
This post quotes CBC News, writing that vaccination rates for children in Alberta aged five to eleven are the lowest in Canada. The post celebrates this fact, and asks if Alberta is waking up.

In response to a tweet that shows data that there is nothing that would convince most anti-vaxxers to get the COVID19 vaccine, this post writes that we should not convince vaxxers nor anti-vaxxers to change their minds. It calls for freedom of choice.

This post includes a link to a campaign by Dear South Africa, a non-profit platform that aims to include the public in government policy-making. It asks people to share their opinion about vaccine passports.
The tweeter tweets an article which explains that three airlines agree with the Biden administration on mandatory vaccinations. The tweeter shares that they are not surprised by this decision.
The tweeter expresses that true patriotism is helping your country through the pandemic by getting vaccinated, wearing and making masks, as well as socially distancing.
The tweeter shares an article from a website called "Stop World Control," which lists 18 reasons why people should not get vaccinated.

This post announces the latest CDC weekly hospitalization data for Americans over 65 years old by vaccination status, showing the highest hospitalization rates are for the unvaccinated and the lowest for the boosted.

This post writes that after a young and fully vaccinated model caught COVID19, she developed myocarditis, rhabdomyolysis, mild pneumonia, and had her legs amputated. It claims the vaccine is at fault for all of it and that not admitting this is gaslighting. It includes a broken link.

This post shares a peer-reviewed study from the Journal of the American Medical Association about health consequences of vaccine exemptions. It argues that there is a clear association between school-based vaccine mandates and lower rates of vaccine-preventable diseases. It also says that being anti-vaccine-mandates is the same as being anti-vaccine.
The tweeter spreads misinformation by saying the general public was used to test COVID-19 vaccines.
The tweeter, who has received their third vaccine, shares their opinion that it is time to lift restrictions.
The tweeter expresses distrust towards the Biden administration and its handling of the pandemic. The tweet also includes a link to an article that does not seem to be from a credible source.
The tweeter claims the COVID-19 vaccine is only viable for three to four months. The tweet also shares an academic article about the safety and efficacy of vaccines.

This post by The Hill News shares an article about Matthew McConaughey waiting for more information before vaccinating his children against COVID19. The article also says McConaughey chose to get vaccinated himself, and that he criticizes conspiracy theories around the vaccine.
The tweeter criticizes someone who is complaining that their son needs to wear a mask when approaching their teacher for help in the classroom.
The tweeter shares an article which explains that Ron DeSantis, governor of Florida, planned to hold an anti-vaccine rally in September 2021.
The Chief Minister of Kerala shares statistics on Kerala's COVID-19 vaccination rates.

This post criticizes the Johnson & Johnson vaccine, writing that all other developed nations were offering RCT-based vaccination, while the UK Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation offered a non-evidence based single dose.

This post is part of a thread by the Springfield Green County Health Department about transitioning their COVID19 testing and vaccination operations to a new location in order to maintain accessibility for the community.

This post shares a BBC News article about what we now know about long term safety of COVID19 vaccines. It writes that after one year of vaccinations, we already have a lot of long term data and evidence suggests vaccines are safe over the long term.
The tweeter encourages people to get vaccinated given the fact that even their pets have to be vaccinated to travel.

This post criticizes the cost of the COVID19 vaccine and vaccine inequity. It writes that less than eleven percent of people in low income countries have received a dose while Moderna charges a premium for its shot.

This post writes that proven COVID19 treatments were taken away so that the experimental COVID19 vaccine could get Emergency Use Authorization. It implies that there has been an intentional conspiracy.

This post by Robert Reich, former Secretary of Labor, criticizes Republican lawmakers for saying all lives matter while not universally supporting vaccines, which are the one thing that we need to save the most lives right now.
The tweeter shares their opinion that getting vaccinated should be a choice but that anti-vaxxers should also realize there are consequences to their choices.
The tweeter calls the COVID-19 vaccine a "sterilizing" vaccine.

This post includes a link to a news article by Vaccine Impact, a suspicious website, claiming that 2433 unborn babies died during an mRNA vaccine study, showing that these COVID19 shots are not safe for pregnant women.
This post tells the story of how the tweeter went to a doctor to get seven different vaccines in the same day, which they needed before starting clinics.

This tweeter writes that they have been in the hospital for months with pain and heart inflammation after getting the second COVID19 vaccine. They criticize the doctors for refusing to give them Ivermectin to combat the vaccine injuries. The post implies the COVID19 vaccine is at fault.

This post shares an article by Boston 25 News about Pfizer recalling the anti-smoking drug Chantix over cancer concerns, writing that while this happens, democrats criticize those who question taking a COVID19 vaccine because of safety concerns.
This post criticizes the COVID19 vaccine passport, writing that they do not work and have turned the public on public health.
Tweeter is implying that students hoping to enter the healthcare sector should take vaccination requirements as part of their ethics course, necessary to complete their degrees.

Tweeter implied that another user lost her arguments in support of vaccine mandates and that unvaccinated people should make be left to make their own choice with regard to their protection against the virus.
This tweet is in reply to another, which has been deleted. So the context of this reply could not be found. But it seems tweeter was trying to tell anti-vaxxers people that vaccines work.
Tweeter is mocking anti-vaxxers by implying that they would do all sorts of irrational, unhealthy things instead of getting vaccinated against COVID-19.
Tweeter, an Australian non-profit, implied that the country's former prime minister was apparently discriminating against some states because vaccines were not delivered quickly enough.

This post questions why UK Education Secretary Zahawi has met with parent groups with proven links to a COVID19 disinformation and anti-vaxx group on several occasions, while not meeting with other parent groups looking for better protection in schools.
This tweet was in reply to a thread where an anti-vaxxer argued that vaccines and shots are not the same things. Tweeter implied that the anti-vaxxer is overestimating their knowledge of vaccines.
Tweeter is implying that governments will try to vaccinate children if vaccine mandates are not nipped at the bud.
Tweeter implied that not all unvaccinated people are Trump supporters.

This post writes that Vaxart has a COVID19 vaccine that is more easily stored and transported, could stop infection and transmission, and can be self administered.  It questions why the United States has not invested in this.
This post shares an article by Alex Berenson’s Unreported Truths. It claims that vaccines prevent you from acquiring full immunity even if you are infected and recover.
This post criticizes COVID19 vaccine and masking mandates, writing that they don’t want to partake and that this is their choice and their business.
This post criticizes an anti-vaxxer who has not read up on the science of vaccines and for thinking that the definition of a vaccine is a matter of opinion.
Tweeter implied that COVID vaccines cause strokes by sharing a YouTube link, no longer available, and referring to the Bright Light News website, which appears to run anti-vaccine propaganda.

This post criticizes Fluenz Tetra nasal flu spray being administered to children in English schools. It says that AstraZeneca UK hold the marketing authorization for the vaccine, calls for people to do their own research and connect the dots, and implies the vaccine is unsafe.

This post criticizes liberals for insisting truckers are endangering people. It also criticizes vaccine mandates, writing that they were never needed, and the COVID19 vaccine, writing that it is not legitimate. It also claims that the coronavirus was never a crisis.

In response to a tweet by ABC News encouraging people to get an mRNA vaccine over the Johnson & Johnson due to new data showing rare blood clot concerns, this post criticizes pharmaceutical companies and the COVID19 vaccine.
Tweeter implied that unvaccinated people are being treated unfairly by governments and society.
This post criticizes the Brazil National Health Application for generating English-language vaccination certificated but only for field names, not for the actual values.
Tweeter is implying that Chicago Tribune is apparently exaggerating COVID-19 transmission in restaurants and bars to push for a vaccine mandate so that businesses can operate normally.

This post writes that the COVID19 vaccine is ineffective and dangerous. It says that Israel’s cases are skyrocketing despite rollout of fourth boosters. It calls for early treatment instead, and for an end to vaccinations.
This post criticizes the United Kingdom government for not providing sufficient support, protection, or information to help citizens stay safe in the COVID19 pandemic.
Tweeter shared a Hill news article about Pfizer's CEO talking about the need for a fourth dose.
Tweeter implied that public health bodies such as CDC and NHS are pushing vaccines on behalf of pharmaceutical companies for making profit and that he does not trust them.
This post writes that ventilation, masking, and getting vaccinated are the tools to stop COVID19 transmission. It emphasizes that COVID19 is airborne.
Tweeter is sharing information about vaccine eligibility in India and asking people to get vaccinated.
Tweeter seems to imply that the government and top brass in the U.S. military will face difficulty for implementing the vaccine mandate.

This post writes that some populations do not have access to vaccines including migrant workers and other vulnerable groups with no access to healthcare, but that this is not a big chunk of the unvaccinated.
Tweeter shared an article from a news website with questionable sources to imply that natural immunity is apparently more effective than COVID vaccines.

This tweeter writes that they have been rooting against football player Aaron Rodgers for many years because they dislike him, and that his refusal to get vaccinated against COVID19 is the latest example.
This post criticizes the COVID19 vaccine passport, saying it is discriminatory and ineffective, and that vaccination does not prevent transmission or infection.

This post links to a news article on Medical Kidnap, a site known for misinformation, about Pfizer allegedly paying off the FDA for COVID19 vaccine approval. It also lists possible adverse effects of the Pfizer vaccine, implying vaccines are illegitimate and dangerous.
Tweeter is implying that by November 2021 COVID 19 fatalities in the U.K. has been lower than in the European Union because of Britain's success in getting its population vaccinated.
This tweet is by a healthcare provider explaining why natural immunity alone cannot provide protection against COVID 19.

Tweeter is implying that Trinidad and Tobago has to discard thousands of Pfizer vaccines not because people did not want them,  but the vaccines expired before those who needed the second dose became eligible for it.

This post quotes from an Ontario Human Rights Commission Statement, which says that receiving a COVID19 vaccine is voluntary, but that those who choose not to get vaccinated do not have the right to accommodation.

In response to a research study (not currently peer-reviewed) about undercounting of mortality rates after COVID19 vaccination, this post congratulates the study author on the analysis and for helping study non-covid mortality spikes in the unvaccinated.

Tweeter shared a post by another user quoting British Medical Journal's associate editor Dr. Peter Doshi's concerns about the COVID vaccines and argument that since vaccines do not prevent infection or stop transmission there should not be any vaccine mandates.
Tweeter implied that intellectual property rights and pharmaceutical company's monopoly to produce vaccine should to removed to ensure vaccine equity around the globe.

This post criticizes Toronto Sun Columnist Brian Lilley, claiming he failed to acknowledge the role of Trudeau, Freeland, Macron, Putin, and Ardern in promoting COVID19 vaccines through the World Economic Forum. It claims this vaccines agenda is a dangerous political and economical move.

This post by the Nevada Health Response explains the process of testing and developing COVID19 vaccines in the United States, including overlapping clinical trial phases, meaning no steps in testing safety were skipped.
Tweeter implied that vaccines alone cannot protect people from COVID 19 infections governments should also enforce mask mandates and indoor air filtration policies.

This post by Salud America, a community group working towards health equity for Latinos, shares a new COVID19 study that found that Latino peer modelling with psychological inoculation can be more effective than traditional forms of promoting vaccines.
Tweeter implied that government cannot tell private entities whether they should or should not enforce vaccine mandates at their companies.
This tweet by the Jerusalem Post shares an article about the European Union being criticized for not disclosing text messages over a Pfizer COVID19 vaccine deal.
This tweeter writes that the vaccine rate in Canada is 84% and that the vaccinated make up 83% of COVID19 cases. Vaccines will not help us get out of the pandemic, it argues.

This post calls for compassion for vaccination centre workers, writing that a local worker had to remind people on their facebook page not to get angry at them for taking their first break in twelve weeks.
This post by Rolling Stone Magazine shares an article about Kid Rock assuring snowflake fans he will cancel gigs with COVID19 vaccine mandates.
Tweeter expressed her shock at a news report from the Daily Mail about Austria making COVID vaccines mandatory for all adults despite huge protest.
Tweeter misinterpreted the result of a scientific study to argue that mRNA-based COVID vaccines are not safe because they have a protein that can apparently cause cancer.
This tweet is by a Nigerian news website reporting that staff employed by the government's health department to inoculate people were not paid.

Tweeter hinted at the hypocrisy of the vaccine mandate by posting a Newsweek article that reports members of U.S. Congress, Senate, and their staff does not fall under the scope of Biden's executive order.

This post by Globe and Mail Columnist Robyn Urback criticizes the trucker convoy, writing that it is disrupting the supply chain to protest measures that disrupt the supply chain. It was never really about trucker vaccine mandates, she writes.
Tweeter shared a Time magazine article about scientists who developed the COVID-19 vaccines.

Tweeter is propagating the conspiracy theory that COVID 19 is actually flu and pharmaceutical companies made it all up to make money from selling vaccines, and also drugs to cure the vaccine's side effects.

By sharing an opinion piece on how the American Supreme court's decision to invalidate Biden Administration's vaccine mandate can be fixed, tweeter implied that they do not agree with the court decision.

meaning: Tweeter seems to oppose the vaccine mandate but tweeter's position regarding the vaccine is not clear from the tweet, which is no longer live.

The tweeter shares misinformation by saying the COVID-19 vaccine does not stop people from contracting or transmitting the virus.

The tweeter spreads misinformation by saying the COVID-19 vaccine is fake, does not follow science and was made to incriminate anti-vaxxers.

Tweeter appears to imply that authorities should deny anti-vaxxers treatment if they get infected with COVID 19 and let them die because by refusing vaccines they are potentially putting other people at risk.
Tweeter implied that people, who criticize critics of COVID restrictions and vaccine mandates, are human rights deniers.
Tweeter, in reply to claims by another user that COVID vaccination killed three people she knows, is saying that millions died from the disease, not the prevention.

An article by the Calgary Sun from January 2022 about how the Edmonton school board was pushing for vaccine clinics in schools due to high infection rates.

This tweet claims that a whistleblower went "on record" about the use of fetal cells in vaccines. According to immunize B.C., some vaccines are made by growing the vaccine viruses in human fetal cell lines. However, the vaccines themselves do not contain fetal cells or tissue.

This pro-vaccine tweeter tells people to get vaccinated. They also say that it's great to have pro-vaccine partners, and they shared a link to a screenshot about a doctor and making health "viral."

The tweeter criticizes public health officials for not exempting persons over 60 from the COVID-19 vaccine, claiming it should be their choice.

It is not clear if tweeter is being sarcastic in calling the potential reduction in the Los Angeles police force due to the vaccine mandate positive news.

The CDC reported that "Although refugees are not required to have vaccinations before arrival in the United States." This post is both anti-vaxx and anti-migrant.

This tweeter is anti-vaxx because they're posting information and data about how vaccines don't work, such as hospitalization numbers. It's not clear where these numbers are coming from, but the link contained within this tweet was removed by Twitter, so the information is false.

This pro-vaccine tweeter says that anti-vaxxers rarely read beyond the headlines, to get to the real information about a story. She says anti-vaxxers lack critical thinking skills. This tweet is part of a long thread about vaccines.

Tweeter implied that vaccinated people with booster jabs have apparently zero chances of getting COVID. Tweeter presented this wrong argument in reply to a tweeter asking why people should get vaccinated.

The context of the tweet is not clear as the original tweet tweeter replied to has been deleted. It seems tweeter is questioning the effectiveness or reliability of COVID vaccines because they have been developed so recently.

Tweet repeating the Pfizer announcement that their vaccine is safe and effective for children five to eleven. Unclear why the tweet was taken offline, no additional information on date posted or user.

Tweet links to a page from the UK government talking about rare instances of myocarditis and other complications from the Covid vaccine. The page contains good information, but this user remains doubtful and claims the government is really admitting guilt or that vaccines are harmful.

This tweeter is anti-vaxx and tells another tweeter to check out the link posted in their Tweet. That link contains paranoid talk from a Zoom type meeting, where people criticize vaccines and spread disinformation.

surge in COVID cases.

This tweet is a news post from CNN. It doesn't promote or criticize anything, rather it replays news about the Department of Justice asking the Supreme Court to reinstate vaccine mandates. CNN is typically pro-vaccine in their reporting.

This tweet is misleading. It claims that an Israeli doctor said that vaccine effectiveness is waning. The tweeter pulled a quote from a heavily edited video though. AFP reported that "the doctor was in fact encouraging vaccination in the full interview, which has been edited to make it appear he says the shot is ineffective."

This tweeter is anti-vaxx and is criticizing the Chinese Communist Party and involving some conspiracy theory within this post about China and Southwest airlines, who mandated vaccines. The tweet implies that companies want to employee foreigners by way of mandating vaccines.

This far-right tweeter says that vaccine mandates made the liberals loose their moral high ground because it will result in adults losing their jobs and being unable to pay for their kids to live well.
This is a news report about how Sarah Palin said she wouldn't get the vaccine. The post contains no personal opinion.
PJ Media is a subscription based right-wing media outlet. They posted an article here to scare people into thinking vaccines are dangerous.

User claims Channel Four news is downplaying the risk of myocarditis in children.

User is replying to a CDC tweet about vaccinating young children, claiming that reducing poverty and improving overall public health funding and infrastructure will work better than a vaccine. Calls on billionaires to provide the funding.
Link to a news article about workers in New South Wales being allowed to return to work with only one vaccine. Tweet/account have since been taken down.

This tweeter is upset that India's poor are not getting vaccinated. This is a critique on vaccine equity. The tweeter also shows a graph sourced from The New York Times that reveals India is falling behind other nations in terms of vaccination rate.
The tweeter claims the government's goal is to keep people divided through race, religion and vaccination status.
The tweeter is responding to an anti-vax post about getting injured from the COVID-19 vaccine. The tweeter's response is a bit incoherent but they seem to be making fun of anti-vaxxers.
The tweeter says that someone who is young and healthy should not be subject to "experimental" COVID-19 vaccines.
The tweeter shares they were required to get vaccinated when they moved to Australia in 1975.

This is a news post from Law & Crime, which media bias.com says has a neutral bias. This tweet is a headline about one political figure getting angry with SCOTUS for ignoring healthcare workers who complain about fetal cells being used in vaccines. The headline is a bit misleading though, therefore I flagged this post as anti-vaxx. Abortions are not utilized for vaccines. Immunize B.C. says that "some vaccines are made by growing the vaccine viruses in human fetal cell lines. However, the vaccines themselves do not contain fetal cells or tissue."
criticism_other: Use of fetal cells in vaccines
